melee.name: Melee
melee.description: This creature excels at close combat and has limited or no ranged combat capabilities.

range.name: range
range.description: This creature attacks from afar and has limited or no Melee combat capabilities.

ambush.name: Ambush
ambush.description: This creature ideally starts combat from a hidden position and waits for the optimal moment to attack.

Airborne.name: Airborne
Airborne.description: This creature has a flying speed and can continuously stay at a distance.

charge.name: Charge
charge.description: This creature seeks close combat from the get-go and will continue to do so.

predator.name: Predator
predator.description: This creature stalks its prey and will withdraw from combat to attack again later.

pack.name: Pack
pack.description: This creature is best utilized as part of a larger group of similar creatures.

regeneration.name: Regeneration
regeneration.description: This creature has abilities allowing it to regenerate hit points during combat.

mobile.name: Mobile
mobile.description: This creature boasts superior speed and mobility, allowing it to quickly reposition itself or give chase to enemies.

tactical.name: Tactical
tactical.description: This creature's abilities facilitate powerful synergies, increasing its effectiveness.

shock.name: Shock
shock.description: This creature is most effective during the first turns of combat.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
spellcasting.description: This creature is capable of casting spells and favours using them in combat.

demanding.name: Demanding
demanding.description: Fighting this monster requires lots of saving throws.

simple.name: Simple
simple.description: This creature's abilites are straightfoward and require little planning to utilize effectively.

lethal.name: Lethal
lethal.description: This creature is more than capable of actually killing a player character.

Area of Effect.name: Area of Effect
Area of Effect.description: This creature heavily utilizes abilities that affect an area, for example by dealing damage to creatures within that area.

interactive.name: Interactive
interactive.description: This creature utilizes a combination of abilities, actions, bonus actions and reactions.

boss.name: Boss
boss.description: This creature boasts impressive stats and abilities, requiring several turns of intense combat that acts as a dramatic climax.

bodyguard.name: Bodyguard
bodyguard.description: This creature aims to protect another creature, rarely leaving its side and acting in the interest of keeping danger from it.

debuff.name: Debuff
debuff.description: This creature weakens or hinders its enemies.

support.name: Support
support.description: This creature strengthens its allies, increasing their effectiveness, but often poses less of a challenge on its own.

tank.name: Tank
tank.description: This creature is extremely resilient, boasting a combination of a high hit point count or AC, resistances or immunities.

minion.name: Minion
minion.description: This creature is relatively harmless on its own and its strength lies in numbers.

damage.name: Damage
damage.description: This creature can be utilized as a reliable source of damage.

mount.name: Mount
mount.description: This creature can serve as a mount for either a player or an enemy.

ally.name: Ally
ally.description: This creature can act as an ally to a group of players.

pressure.name: Pressure
pressure.description: This creature provides unique challenges able to overwhelm its enemies.

hunter.name: Hunter
hunter.description: This creature concentrates its attention on single targets.

leader.name: Leader
leader.description: This creature is best utilized as the leader of a group of enemies, acting as a lynchpin for the encounter.

duelist.name: Duelist
duelist.description: This creature's set of abilities allows for an exciting back and forth with a single opponent.

gimmick.name: Gimmick
gimmick.description: This creature possesses one or more gimmicks, specific and unique mechanics, that an encounter with this creature will revolve around.

swallow.name: Swallow
swallow.description: This creature can and will swallow players, splitting parties and possibly dealing damage over time.

critter.name: Critter
critter.description: A low-CR creature posing almost no challenge by itself, therefore rarely used in combat. Usually used for flavor, worldbuilding, or odd encounters.

vehicle.name: Vehicle
vehicle.description: Constructed for warfare or transport, a vehicle usually has to be crewed and rarely serves as an opponent on its own.

classic.name: Classic
classic.description: A widely recognized or frequently used monster type. Common across many campaigns and representative of core setting themes.

legendary.name: Legendary
legendary.description: This creature poses a formidable and complex challenge, makes use of legendary actions and requires special attention regarding the conception and execution of an encounter with it.

000-goblin_pack_1_crookshank.description: Crookshanks mark the rank and file of a Raid Rabble, both conscripted and willing participants of mixed age and skill. Most goblins are used to fight creatures larger than them and they make the most of it, trying to swarm enemies to bring them down, where their eponymous crooked blades are waiting. Goblins aren't eager to die fighting, as each dead goblin weakens the tribe. This utilitarian view on survival has earned them a reputation of cowardice, but if Goblins commit to a fight, they do so without hesitation, fully aware of their mortality and knowing that their death will only empower the raid, as their Shaman draws great strength from them.
000-goblin_pack_1_crookshank.name: Goblin Crookshank

properties.shortdesc: Versatile goblin warrior.

000-goblin_pack_1_hog_rider.description: Hog Riders are brawny and boorish, characteristics they share with their black-bristled mounts. They are veterans of several raids, having earned their place upon the back of a towering boar. They are fast in and fast out, barreling forth from the underbrush and into the thick of combat before turning on their heel, grabbing what they can and retreating once the rest of the Rabble swarms in. Once the baggage is secured, the rest of the Raid Rabble retreats back into cover, with arrows and grenades raining unto eventual pursuers from hidden Shrublurkers.
000-goblin_pack_1_hog_rider.name: Goblin Hog Rider

properties.shortdesc: Hog Riders are brawny and boorish, characteristics they share with their black-bristled...

000-goblin_pack_1_rabble_rouser.description: Within the confines of a goblin village everyone has to pull their weight. There is no place for ego, grudges or feuds, as time is better spent improving the ever slim chances of the tribe's survival than to indulge in petty conflicts. Some goblins chafe under this, for reasons of temper, personality or sheer stubborn obstinacy. A Raid Rabble is a great way to send these Rabble-Rousers to blow off some steam, before they start developing some dangerous thoughts. This is a win-win situation, as they make for furious warriors, passionate looters and grandstanding braggarts, taking their attention away from getting into trouble, continuously telling of their heroic deeds instead. That is, if they return.
000-goblin_pack_1_rabble_rouser.name: Goblin Rabble Rouser

properties.shortdesc: Within the confines of a goblin village everyone has to pull their weight.

000-goblin_pack_1_shrublurker.description: Shrublurkers spend most of their life outside the confines of a goblin village and are both feared and respected for it. Children like to test boundaries and explore their surroundings, goblin childred are no different. If they venture to far from the village, chances of survival are slim. But those who return exhibit a knack for survival and necessary amount of luck that qualifies them for adoption by a senior Shrublurker, the old veteran hoping to impart as much knowledge as possible on their successor before their inevitable death. Shrublurkers are expert trackers and trappers and are forced to quickly adapt to the flora and fauna surrounding their village or die an early death. During a raid, Shrublurkers act as scouts, sharpshooters and saboteurs, exposing key weaknesses or marking priority targets.
000-goblin_pack_1_shrublurker.name: Goblin Shrublurker

properties.shortdesc: Shrublurkers spend most of their life outside the confines of a goblin village and are...

000-goblin_pack_1_soulshaper_shaman.description: Soulshaper Shamans oversee a tribe's death rites and stand vigil during the transition of a goblin's soul beyond the mortal veil. They do this to take note of where this particular soul goes, to eventually drag it back to fulfill various purposes, should the need arise. Necessity is the mother of invention, goblins die in droves - why not capitalise on that? The goblins are thankful for their ancestor's service and both live and die knowing that their duty does not end in death. A Shaman's word carries a lot of weight, as they are known to converse with the spirits of the afterlife and carry the knowledge of the ancestors. Most shamans however quickly find out that dying does not automatically impart knowledge and most ancestors are as dense in death as they were in life. This realisation usually sours a Soulshaper Shaman's mood and factors into their characteristic bitterness.
000-goblin_pack_1_soulshaper_shaman.name: Goblin Soulshaper Shaman

properties.shortdesc: Soulshaper Shamans oversee a tribe's death rites and stand vigil during the transition...

000-goblin_pack_1_soulstarved_abominatio.description: The shambling and frankly horrifying Soulstarved Abominations are Soulshaper Shaman's failed attempt to just kind of stuff a goblin's soul back into a vessel, be it their former body or an vaguely goblin-shaped flesh-construct. Still, something must have worked out as planned, as these aptly named Abominations walk and fight, despite their unsettling appearence and even more unsettling hunger for flesh. If a Soulshaper Shaman is part of a Raid Rabble, the Abominations can be found shuffling in its wake, herded by their creator into combat as unliving weapons.
000-goblin_pack_1_soulstarved_abominatio.name: Goblin Soulstarved Abomination

properties.shortdesc: Herded into battle by a Soulshaper-Shaman.

000-month_1_bone_hag.description: Bone Hags abhor Civilized's ever expanding need for greater cities and more farmland.They regard each village as nothing but a malign growth with the potential to mutate into a tumorous City if left unchecked. As they draw strength from their bindings to the bones of the earth, the very essence of the primordial titans who gave up their bodies to create room for earthbound life, they require earth and stone untouched by tools or stonecraft, violently subduing any outside attempts to encroach on their domains.
000-month_1_bone_hag.name: Bone Hag

properties.shortdesc: Bone Hags abhor Civilized's ever expanding need for greater cities and more...

000-month_10_skeleton_dragon.description: A dragon's might appears to be limited only by the constraints of a physical form, forcing it to obey the laws of mortality, as they already ignore those of physics, displaying this particular brand of hybris everytime they take flight. Imagine now this creature no lounger bound to a mortal shell, instead transcending the border between life and death to become something even greater, something even more terrifying. Wreathed in night-coloured soulfire and with a malign spark lightning up its empty eye sockets, a Skeleton Dragon is a draconic nightmare given form, its mere presence draining colour from life and hope from the heart of mortal folk.
000-month_10_skeleton_dragon.name: Skeleton Dragon

properties.shortdesc: A dragon's might appears to be limited only by the constraints of a physical form...

000-month_11_mother_base.description: Since its inception, various models of the Mobile Operations Transport and Headquarters for Exploration and Reconnaissance Base - or in short Mother Base - serve as a staging post for governmental or private operations, scientific expeditions or incursions into the planar cosmos. Powered by experimental arcane reactors and highly classified clockwork magic, outfitted with different means of environmental traversal and equipped with state of the art weaponry, Mother Base is highly automated and can even act autonomously, lending fire support or tactical assistance to its crew. However, its developers notice with increasing concern that Mother Base units start to develop close bonds with their pilots and crew over time, even behaving irrationally, acting outside of permitted protocol or in other ways considered impossible to protect or even avenge their attached unit.
000-month_11_mother_base.name: M.O.T.H.E.R. Base

properties.shortdesc: Mobile headquarters with advanced techno-machinery.

000-month_12_dreamweaver.description: Dreamweavers are the single-minded offspring of the Weavstress. With their oneiric toxins, they are able to manipulate the flow of the Dreamweave, the illusory realm through which the victims of the Weavstress sleepwalk, in order to exert direct control over the behavior of the dreamers.
000-month_12_dreamweaver.name: Dreamweaver

properties.shortdesc: Dreamweavers are the single-minded offspring of the Weavstress.

000-month_12_weavstress.description: The Weavstress is a sinister creature, the extent of its cruel and deceitful nature hidden behind this unassuming title. This colossal arachnid weaves its silvery threads into intricate traps, capable of spinning almost invisible, delicate strands and massive ropes with the strength of steel cables. These threads are soaked in narcotic secretions, inducing hallucinations or narcoleptic episodes. Sleeping creatures are then controlled by the Weavstresses spider-like brood, the Dreamweavers, through narcotic poisons, acting against their will and dancing to the ethereal tunes of the Weavstresses' haunting song.
000-month_12_weavstress.name: Weavstress

properties.shortdesc: The Weavstress is a sinister creature, the extent of its cruel and deceitful nature...

000-month_13_chimera.description: Technically, any monstrosity combining the traits of various beasts within a creature is a chimera. But there are instances, where magical happenstance, particularly repulsive instances of procreation or especially ambitious broodmasters create something greater than the sum of its parts, a bestial force driven by a need for domination, channeling the pain and madness coursing through its unnatural body into a destructive force that is terrifying to behold.
000-month_13_chimera.name: Chimera

properties.shortdesc: Technically, any monstrosity combining the traits of various beasts within a creature...

000-month_14_dwarven_battlebrewer.description: Brewing is more than just a craft for dwarves; it's a cultural cornerstone deeply intertwined with the local identity of their decentralized and often isolated societies. Each mountain kingdom or cavernous realm, has their unique brews enriched with customs and culture. Whether it's hearty whiskey with hints of volcanic smoke, clear schnapps with sparkling mineral particles, or strong beer brewed from underground river water, they all have the power to soothe weary hands and quickly loosen knotted muscles. With their potent brews, Battle-Brewers specialize in maintaining the esprit de corps and, with their down-to-earth and jovial nature, they ease the hardships of military life, all while never hesitating to get their hands dirty themselves.
000-month_14_dwarven_battlebrewer.name: Dwarven Battle-Brewer

properties.shortdesc: Brewing is more than just a craft for dwarves; it's a cultural cornerstone deeply...

000-month_14_dwarven_brewers_barrel.description: Brewing is more than just a craft for dwarves; it's a cultural cornerstone deeply intertwined with the local identity of their decentralized and often isolated societies. Each mountain kingdom or cavernous realm, has their unique brews enriched with customs and culture. Whether it's hearty whiskey with hints of volcanic smoke, clear schnapps with sparkling mineral particles, or strong beer brewed from underground river water, they all have the power to soothe weary hands and quickly loosen knotted muscles. With their potent brews, Battle-Brewers specialize in maintaining the esprit de corps and, with their down-to-earth and jovial nature, they ease the hardships of military life, all while never hesitating to get their hands dirty themselves.
000-month_14_dwarven_brewers_barrel.name: Dwarven Brewers Barrel

properties.shortdesc: Brewing is more than just a craft for dwarves; it's a cultural cornerstone deeply...

000-month_14_dwarven_brewers_boarcart.description: Traditionally, the Battle-Brewers carts are pulled by mighty boars, serving both as beasts of burden and defenders of the Brewer's mobile tavern and improvised brewery. These boars are nurtured from birth and raised on a secret diet, likely involving copious amounts of dwarven spirits, to enhance their already considerable combat prowess.
000-month_14_dwarven_brewers_boarcart.name: Dwarven Brewer's Boar Cart

properties.shortdesc: A Battle-Brewer's mobile bar.

000-month_14_giant_boar.description: Countless royal hunting expeditions have been thrown into disarray by the ferocity of a single regular boar, leaving a trail of hunters scarred by their encounters - not all living to tell the tale. Giants among their already towering kind, giant boars dwarf their ordinary brethren, doubling in stature and quadrupling in mass. When a rampaging giant boar charges, conventional methods falter, and its onslaught often rivals the devastation normally reserved for natural disasters.
000-month_14_giant_boar.name: Giant Boar

properties.shortdesc: Countless royal hunting expeditions have been thrown into disarray by the ferocity of a...

000-month_15_bear.description: When one encounters a full-grown bear in the wild, it becomes clear why people started building walls. Bulky slabs of muscle shifting under an armor of dense fur and tough skin that can resist even blades, powerful jaws and giant, mighty paws - Bears are faster, stronger, and more mobile than most humanoid beings, and their legendary resilience has inspired many tribal societies to revere the bear totem as a symbol of primal fortitude.
000-month_15_bear.name: Bear

properties.shortdesc: When one encounters a full-grown bear in the wild, it becomes clear why people started...

000-month_15_crocodile.description: Crocodiles appear to sport a self-satisfied grin, almost as if they're aware they're a pinnacle of evolutionary success. While others had to develop fins or feet to find their niche, those very appendages often ended up on the menu of lurking crocodiles. The stars of their own evolutionary success story ensure that life near water remains thrilling.
000-month_15_crocodile.name: Crocodile

properties.shortdesc: Crocodiles appear to sport a self-satisfied grin, almost as if they're aware they're a...

000-month_15_shaman.description: From shaman-kings who rule tribal societies by a mandate granted by the ancestral spirits, reclusive hermits safeguarding the balance and harmony of nature, to storm-callers and earth-shakers whose words unleash the full fury of elemental wrath, shamans are pivotal figures in societies that, through a deep connection to nature and ancestral worship, have not lost their link to the past and the surrounding natural world.
000-month_15_shaman.name: Shaman

properties.shortdesc: From shaman-kings who rule tribal societies by a mandate granted by the ancestral...

000-month_16_cathedral_knight.description: Cathedral Knights are towering undead tasked with guarding the great Cathedral of Silence, the spiritual center of the Deathrite Cult. Drawn from the Unspeaking, the undead martial elite of the Cult, they bask in the soundless tolling of the great cathedral's leaden bells, causing them to grow to towering size over time. Cathedral Knights are deployed to crush particularly obstinate enemies of the Cult and are always accompanied by Bell Ringers, empowering the Cathedral Knights with deathrite rituals and maintaining the shroud of blessed silence.
000-month_16_cathedral_knight.name: Cathedral Knight

properties.shortdesc: Cathedral Knights are towering undead tasked with guarding the great Cathedral of...

000-month_16_deathrite_bellringer.description: Cathedral Knights are towering undead tasked with guarding the great Cathedral of Silence, the spiritual center of the Deathrite Cult. Drawn from the Unspeaking, the undead martial elite of the Cult, they bask in the soundless tolling of the great cathedral's leaden bells, causing them to grow to towering size over time. Cathedral Knights are deployed to crush particularly obstinate enemies of the Cult and are always accompanied by Bell Ringers, empowering the Cathedral Knights with deathrite rituals and maintaining the shroud of blessed silence.
000-month_16_deathrite_bellringer.name: Deathrite Bellringer

properties.shortdesc: Cathedral Knights are towering undead tasked with guarding the great Cathedral of...

000-month_17_cursed_cannon.description: The 12th of 13 comically oversized ship cannons commissioned by a pirate queen, now purged from history, to arm the flagship of her ill-fated fleet. The entire fleet vanished under mysterious circumstances without firing a single shot while traversing the waters near the Bleak Reef. Now, deprived of her baptism of fire and somehow salvaged from her watery Graves, this mass of barnacles and iron is suffused with the vengeful thoughts of the ship, captain, and crew. It thirsts for the scent of gunpowder and the shattering of planks, with vengeful energies coalescing within this magnificent weapon, ready to unleash hell even as its wood remains in a continuous state of rot and its once polished metal is thick with rust. A magnificent heavyweight of an enemy for any hard-hitting maritime encounter!
000-month_17_cursed_cannon.name: Drusilla the Drowned

properties.shortdesc: A powerful cannon crewed by the undead.

000-month_18_duskshroud_wyvern.description: The transition between day and night marks a special time, a liminal space at the border between light and darkness. Two domains, eternally intertwined in primordial duality, merge for a brief moment, creating a fleeting moment of balance. This space is the hunting ground of Duskshroud Wyverns, light-born and night-clad minor dragons who use the dim twilight hours to lurk at the edge of night, moving in eerie silence and killing with cold delight.
000-month_18_duskshroud_wyvern.name: Duskshroud Wyvern

properties.shortdesc: The transition between day and night marks a special time, a liminal space at the...

000-month_19_shamblevault_casket_bearer.description: The Shamblevaults are hidden oubliette-structures where hordes of undead creatures are imprisoned, awaiting the call of their master to be summoned when needed. Through massive blackwood caskets, ambitious necromancers can draw forth undead abominations directly from the nightmarish depths of these vaults. The towering Casket Bearers, hulking figures bound to their masters' will, provide the perfect solution to the logistical challenge of hauling around a colossal, chain-wrapped sarcophagus.
000-month_19_shamblevault_casket_bearer.name: Shamblevault Casket Bearer

properties.shortdesc: The Shamblevaults are hidden oubliette-structures where hordes of undead creatures are...

000-month_2_magma_wyrm.description: Magma Wyrms inhabit the most inhospitable terrain imaginable, breeding at the black sand shores of great lava lakes or within the noxious calderas of active volcanoes. Glowing red with inner heat and covered in glistening obdsidan scales, fighting these great Wyrms head on is foolhardy bordering suicidal and only the greatest (or most boastful) dwarven heros are said to having defied a Wyrm's withering heat and extinguished its molten core.
000-month_2_magma_wyrm.name: Magma Wyrm

properties.shortdesc: Magma Wyrms inhabit the most inhospitable terrain imaginable, breeding at the black...

000-month_20_shade_tyrant.description: Fallen knights, oathbroken and consumed by shadows, return as dreaded Shade Tyrants.
000-month_20_shade_tyrant.name: Shade Tyrant

properties.shortdesc: Fallen knights, oathbroken and consumed by shadows, return as dreaded Shade Tyrants.

000-month_20_slaveshade.description: Slaveshades serve Shade Tyrants, created by their dark masters from stolen shadows.
000-month_20_slaveshade.name: Slaveshade

properties.shortdesc: Slaveshades serve Shade Tyrants, created by their dark masters from stolen shadows.

000-month_21_orc_war_tyrant.description: The Warchief is the single greatest authority within the ranks of a war host - an inspiring, or at least intimidating, leader, a successful commander and a powerful warrior. If they set foot onto a battlefield, their troops throw themselves every more recklessly at the enemy ranks, seeking the approval of their sovereign. Every trace of weakness must purged and every defeat could spell doom for an aspiring conqueror. This realisation often leaves War Chiefs paranoid and choleric, while their constant need to prove their might and tactical acumen drives them to ever greater bloodshed and destruction.
000-month_21_orc_war_tyrant.name: Orc War Tyrant

properties.shortdesc: The Warchief is the single greatest authority within the ranks of a war host - an...

000-month_22_executioner_knight_balthusa.description: A steel-clad killing machine dominating in close combat.
000-month_22_executioner_knight_balthusa.name: Executioner Knight Balthusar

properties.shortdesc: A steel-clad killing machine dominating in close combat.

000-month_22_executioner_knight_cadre.description: The breaker of bodies and the breaker of minds acting in tandem.
000-month_22_executioner_knight_cadre.name: Executioner Knight Cadre

properties.shortdesc: The breaker of bodies and the breaker of minds acting in tandem.

000-month_22_executioner_knight_vorrst.description: A steel-clad killing machine dominating in close combat.
000-month_22_executioner_knight_vorrst.name: Executioner Knight Vorrst

properties.shortdesc: A steel-clad killing machine dominating in close combat.

000-month_23_living_fossil_ankylosaurus.description: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and elemental power.
000-month_23_living_fossil_ankylosaurus.name: Living Fossil Ankylosaurus

properties.shortdesc: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and...

000-month_23_living_fossil_quetzalcoatlu.description: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and elemental power.
000-month_23_living_fossil_quetzalcoatlu.name: Living Fossil Quetzalcoatlus

properties.shortdesc: Airborne, buffs fellow earth elementals.

000-month_23_living_fossil_smilodon.description: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and elemental power.
000-month_23_living_fossil_smilodon.name: Living Fossil Smilodon

properties.shortdesc: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and...

000-month_23_living_fossil_tyrannosaurus.description: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and elemental power.
000-month_23_living_fossil_tyrannosaurus.name: Living Fossil Tyrannosaurus

properties.shortdesc: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and...

000-month_24_elder_lindwurm.description: The Elder Lindwyrm is a vast, serpentine abomination:  a body as long as a siege tower is tall,scaled in a sickly sheen of green and bronze, its hide constantly weeping toxic mucus that simmers where it touches soil or stone. it bears no wings or noble bearing, adorns no crests - and it hates the true dragons for that.born of ancient wyrmstock but denied the gifts of flight and majesty, the lindwyrm festers with corrosive jealousy. it despises dragonkind, a bastard sibling clawing at a birthright it was never granted. it does not hoard gold, but slays those who do. it does not rule with majesty, but tears down those who dare. most insidiously, the lindwyrm prefers to strike at those under a dragons protection, hunting them not for sustenance, but as bait, each kill an invitation for their patron to come and face it. and when the dragon answers the call, the lindwyrm coils tight, drowning wings in mud and venom, in a desperate attempt to prove superior.
000-month_24_elder_lindwurm.name: Elder Lindwyrm

properties.shortdesc: Highly mobile serpentine dragon with unique venom mechanics.

000-month_25_bileblood_tyrant.description: Among dragons, the title tyrant is earned through blood and ruin. tyrants do not merely seek dominion over mortals; they aim to ascend the hierarchy of their own kind. its corrosive bile begins seeping through ruptured organs and mixing with its own lifeblood. this fusion forms the bloodbile, a hyper-acidic substance that floods its veins and spills from its wounds in hissing rivulets. powerful enough to eat through the nigh impervious armor of other dragons, it is this perversion of its own nature that allows a black dragon to become a bileblood tyrant. tyrants seek out the territories of rival dragons, challenging their rule and despoiling their lands. they delight in unmaking what others have built: be it hoards, dominion, or legacy. they often begin their campaigns by hunting down the favored champions of their enemies. once they cripple the defenders, the tyrant claims what remains, leaving only corroded wilderness in its wake.
000-month_25_bileblood_tyrant.name: Bileblood Tyrant

properties.shortdesc: More dangerous when Bloodied, may cause instant death.

000-month_26_cloud_charge.description: This is a marker for the Cloud Eater.
000-month_26_cloud_charge.name: Cloud Charge

properties.shortdesc: This is a marker for the Cloud Eater.

000-month_26_cloud_eater.description: Of course, not all dragons can be neatly categorized as chromatic or metallic. dragons exist at the extremes of many metaphysical forces, and the elements are only one of them. Among the most awe-inspiring examples are cloud eaters, titanic storm dragons that shroud their solid physical forms in ephemeral cloudstuff, gradually becoming one with the storms they command over the course of centuries. they are living weather cycles made manifest, creating clouds as they consume them, and capable of unleashing the most devastating aspects of the storm.though ancient and wise, their half-corporeal existence has alienated them from the mundane world. by now, they resemble living natural disasters more than thinking, breathing creatures.
000-month_26_cloud_eater.name: Cloud Eater

properties.shortdesc: Creates and devours clouds to unleash storm-centered effects.

000-month_26_cloud_zone.description: This is a marker for the cloud eater.
000-month_26_cloud_zone.name: Cloud Zone

properties.shortdesc: This is a marker for the Cloud Eater.

000-month_27_iron_shrike.description: controls creatures with chains and impales them on conjured spires.
000-month_27_iron_shrike.name: Iron Shrike

properties.shortdesc: Controls creatures with chains and impales them on conjured spires.

000-month_3_draconic_elite.description: Draconic Elites are otherworldly might given vaguely humanoid shape, towering man-dragons boasting a scaled hide, reptilian maw and scything talons. Their winged, bipedal grants them total aerial superiority, skilled Elites capable of outmaneuvering even their ancestral patrons. As guardians of ancient ruins, instruments of divine judgment or a greater dragon's equerry, their presence invokes both fear and reverence, their martial prowess a testament to the potency of this convergence.
000-month_3_draconic_elite.name: Draconic Elite

properties.shortdesc: Draconic Elites are otherworldly might given vaguely humanoid shape, towering...

000-month_4_valkyrie.description: The Valkyrie's purpose transcends mere escorts of the fallen, for they are seekers of the Allfather's mightiest foes across all realms. Traversing the boundless expanse of countless worlds, they remain unyielding in their quest, the relentless pursuit of proving their mettle, that they may someday prove skillful enough to perceive the skeins of fate, recognizing warriors worthy of a place within the golden halls of heroism. Forged in the fires of battle and beaten into shape upon the anvil of her expectations, there are no greater warriors than those growing under the winged shadow of the Allfather's champions.
000-month_4_valkyrie.name: Valkyrie

properties.shortdesc: The Valkyrie's purpose transcends mere escorts of the fallen, for they are seekers of...

000-month_5_crownbreaker_archwyvern.description: Crownbreaker Archwyverns are the equivalent of a sentient tornado deciding that it wants to battle the nearest earthquake for catastrophic supremacy. Crownbreakers live to fight for the top of the food chain, tirelessly working their way from territory to territory, domain to domain, tirelessly challenging the rulers of those realms - be they other wyverns, chimeras, giants or even true dragons. Through physical strength, raw aggression, and ceaseless savagery alone, these colossal Arch-Wyverns manage to triumph over opponents that seem many times more powerful than their challengers. With each victory, the Arch-Wyvern emerges stronger, and with each triumph, it comes closer to its goal of absolute martial dominance.
000-month_5_crownbreaker_archwyvern.name: Crownbreaker Archwyvern

properties.shortdesc: Crownbreaker Archwyverns are the equivalent of a sentient tornado deciding that it...

000-month_6_emissary_of_annihilation.description: The Emissaries of Annihilation are dedicated to the eradication of all life from the universe. They have long abandoned their organic bodies and now act as constructed conduits for an all-annihilating force of non-organic decay. They have created cosmic disciplines that tap into the deconstructive power of complete negation and null-essence to obliterate beings, magic, or even space itself, leaving gaping wounds in reality and motes of dust weightlessly drifting before dispersing, their origin soon to be forgotten by an unfeeling universe.
000-month_6_emissary_of_annihilation.name: Emissary Of Annihilation

properties.shortdesc: The Emissaries of Annihilation are dedicated to the eradication of all life from the...

000-month_7_azure_dragon_sage.description: Dragon-Sages travel the world, offering their wisdom and experience to those whose philosophies align with their own. Most of them are hundreds of years old, and their gaze discerns patterns and causalities that remain hidden to most. Thus, they assume various roles, from saviors to destroyers, to steer the course of history in a way that aligns with their own nature. Characteristic of Azure Dragon-Sages is the pursuit of freedom for all peoples, and their arrival often heralds revolution and reformation. Some act as advisors, being able to foretel the future by discerning cloud patterns, some as elite instructors or even military leaders, their troops marching to the drum-beat of distant thunder.
000-month_7_azure_dragon_sage.name: Azure Dragon Sage

properties.shortdesc: Dragon-Sages travel the world, offering their wisdom and experience to those whose...

000-month_8_lord_of_dust.description: The Ankhir Empire crumbled under the tireless assaults of their unliving former kings and generals, the populace being massacred by those they once worshiped. Soon the numbing desert sand settled on the sunken ruins of sprawling cities, with only the pyramidical god-prisons looming in quiet reminiscence of a cursed realm swallowed by the sand. Woe betide those who stumble upon the ruins of old, cursed Ankh! If roused from their slumber, the forgotten horrors will surely redden the sands once more.

000-srd_white_dragon_wyrmling.description: A feral frostspawn, already on the hunt.

000-srd_wight.name: Wight
000-srd_wight.description: Its presence raises fallen foes to fight alongside it.

000-srd_winter_wolf.name: Winter Wolf
000-srd_winter_wolf.description: Its haunting howls signal the approach of the pack.

000-srd_wolf.name: Wolf

Draining life and instilling dread.

000-srd_wyvern.name: Wyvern

000-srd_xorn.name: Xorn
000-srd_xorn.description: A rocky elemental tunneler, it devours metals and stone and claws through earth.

000-srd_young_black_dragon.name: Young Black Dragon
000-srd_young_black_dragon.description: A stealthy terror lurking in murky swamps, striking with corrosive fury.

properties.shortdesc: A stealthy terror lurking in murky swamps, striking with corrosive fury.

000-srd_young_blue_dragon.name: Young Blue Dragon
000-srd_young_blue_dragon.description: A storm-charged predator stalking Wastelands with deadly precision.

properties.shortdesc: A storm-charged predator stalking Wastelands with deadly precision.

000-srd_young_brass_dragon.name: Young Brass Dragon
000-srd_young_brass_dragon.description: s gleaming scales reflect desert sun as it breathes scalding acid and engages foes with playful taunts. Its curiosity makes it as unpredictable as it is dangerous.

properties.shortdesc: s gleaming scales reflect desert sun as it breathes scalding acid and engages foes...

000-srd_young_bronze_dragon.name: Young Bronze Dragon
000-srd_young_bronze_dragon.description: A vigilant protector striking with thunder and confusion.

properties.shortdesc: A vigilant protector striking with thunder and confusion.

000-srd_young_copper_dragon.name: Young Copper Dragon
000-srd_young_copper_dragon.description: A quick-witted ambusher, always one step ahead of its opponents.

properties.shortdesc: A quick-witted ambusher, always one step ahead of its opponents.

000-srd_young_gold_dragon.name: Young Gold Dragon
000-srd_young_gold_dragon.description: A radiant flameborn cub, small yet noble and fiercely protective.

properties.shortdesc: A radiant flameborn cub, small yet noble and fiercely protective.

000-srd_young_green_dragon.name: Young Green Dragon
000-srd_young_green_dragon.description: A manipulative predator hiding among trees, exhaling poisonous doom.

properties.shortdesc: A manipulative predator hiding among trees, exhaling poisonous doom.

000-srd_young_red_dragon.description: A greedy flame-winged terror scorching mountains and claiming all.

properties.shortdesc: A greedy flame-winged terror scorching mountains and claiming all.

000-srd_young_silver_dragon.name: Young Silver Dragon
000-srd_young_silver_dragon.description: A noble guardian gliding through snow, freezing foes with conviction.

properties.shortdesc: A noble guardian gliding through snow, freezing foes with conviction.

000-srd_zombie.name: Zombie
000-srd_zombie.description: Undead husk, pursuing the living with mindless hunger.

properties.shortdesc: Undead husk, pursuing the living with mindless hunger.

001-primal_vampire_spawn.description: Sometimes Vampires impart the dubious gift of spawndom upon the wrong soul, stirring primordial horrors from their sleep. These vampire spawns regress to a primal state, detached from the rules that even compel their creators, driven only by their lust for terror and agony.  Primal Spawns are beyond their unwilling creators' control and they in turn feel disdain for their more evolved kin. Despite not having a weakness to sunlight, they prefer the shadows, as the darkness supports their preferred hunting style. And if the right opportunity arises, a Primal Vampire Spawn will not hesitate to hunt during broad daylight to indulge in the screams of horrified onlookers.
001-primal_vampire_spawn.name: Primal Vampire Spawn

properties.shortdesc: Sometimes Vampires impart the dubious gift of spawndom upon the wrong soul, stirring...

002-gluttony.description: This creature is the embodiment of self indulgence, the nature-given love and need for sustenance perverted and twisted into a bloated creature of repulsive proportions. Gluttony poisons mind and body in equal measure and hungers endlessly, existing for the singular purpose to make everything in existence one with itself.
002-gluttony.name: Gluttony

properties.shortdesc: This creature is the embodiment of self indulgence, the nature-given love and need for...

003-inquisitorial_penitent.description: Inquisitorial Penitents are former witches, persecuted and excruciatingly converted by those they now serve as living weapons. Their connection to the arcane has been perverted, the flow of magic reversed, as they now syphon arcane energies from others with their mere presence. They stalk the lands in packs, travel as independent operatives or are part of an inquisitorial retinue, acting as both bodyguards and executioners. The most dangerous penitents, however, are those who underwent the purifications voluntarily, eager to shed the taint of witchcraft. They are the most unforgiving and zealous of their kind, hunting their tainted kin without mercy or remorse.
003-inquisitorial_penitent.name: Inquisitorial Penitent

properties.shortdesc: Inquisitorial Penitents are former witches, persecuted and excruciatingly converted by...

004-curseweaver.description: Curseweavers are sinister creatures exhibiting a perverse interest in the political dealings of mortal beings.
004-curseweaver.name: Curse Weaver

properties.shortdesc: Curseweavers are sinister creatures exhibiting a perverse interest in the political...

005-assassin.description: If one seeks to end a life, one does not necessarily have to get their hands dirty. There are professionals trained in the art of killing, who are eager to be of service - either to earn some coin, further a dark agenda or for personal pleasure. The play of murder has thousands of scripts and props, but a knife in the dark remains an all time classic.
005-assassin.name: Novice Assassin

properties.shortdesc: If one seeks to end a life, one does not necessarily have to get their hands dirty.

006-shield_guardian.description: Exposure to extreme instances of magnetism might cause an as of yet unexplained transformation within Shield Guardians.The docile automatons undergo a rapid evolution, triggering both a physical transformation and a severe change in behaviour. A Polarized Shield Guardian is no longer bound to its master, resisting any attempt of external control with violent means. Their physique adapts to support a construct now geared towards offensive conflict resolution, rather than silent endurance. These creatures are exceedingly rare and, if able to break their shackles for good, wander the lands guided by their mysterious connection to both magical and magnetic forces.
006-shield_guardian.name: Polarized Shield Guardian

properties.shortdesc: Exposure to extreme instances of magnetism might cause an as of yet unexplained...

007-umber_spinner.description: Umber Hulks spend their youthful days terrorising the Underdark or similar subterranean spaces. In this harsh environment, few survive long enough to see their powerful frame diminish with age, shedding the recognizable heavy chitinous plating and finally sprouting wings and a wicked stinger. On buzzing wings the now pubescent Umber Spinners set out, seeking weakened or isolated humanoids in their mission to preserve the dominion of their kind...
007-umber_spinner.name: Umber Spinner

properties.shortdesc: Inject Umber Hulk eggs into creatures, triggering horrifying transformation.

008-gluttonys_aspect.description: Dull-looking, dimwitted and bloated creatures, filled to the brim with noxious gas and disgusting thoughts. They nest within the fleshy crevasses of Gluttony's lumpy body and swarm out on its command, eager to gather offerings to gain their master's favour.
008-gluttonys_aspect.name: Gluttony's Aspect

properties.shortdesc: Demon-spawn of Gluttony, flood the battlefield and gather its tithe.

009-skeleton_henchman.description: If you are interested in exercising cross-regional influence and could not care less about your image,  Skeleton Henchmen are the ideal lynchpin for your entourage. They are loyal, cheap and, if you know your way around the local cemetery, rather easy to aquire. The basic Skeleton Henchman is a great foundation to expand upon, as they are highly customizable and require minimal upkeep and maintenance. Guard duty, law enforcement or warfare, Skeleton Henchmen provide satisfactory service in diverse work environments.
009-skeleton_henchman.name: Skeleton Henchman

properties.shortdesc: If you are interested in exercising cross-regional influence and could not care less...

010-horse.description: Horses are half a ton worth of muscle crammed into an elegant and timeless frame. They are fast, they are not particularly intelligent and they are an essential component of the fantasy genre. In the context of adventuring, Horses are mainly used for travel and battle, although they may as well become trusted and loved companions to the players. This reimagination of the classic Horse embodies a sturdy and valiant creature able to support it's party on arduous voyages as well as dire combat scenarios.
010-horse.name: Horse

properties.shortdesc: Horses are half a ton worth of muscle crammed into an elegant and timeless frame.

011-trained_fighter.description: War veterans, gang members with military experience or nobles who spent a fair share of their youth under the watchful eyes of combat instructors - the Trained Fighter represents all of them and more. They are trained in the art of Melee, have seen various combat scenarios and lived to tell the tale. While a rabble of peasants or a gang of highwaymen can be disposed of rather quickly and with little effort, an organized troop of Trained Fighters makes for a varitable fighting force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
011-trained_fighter.name: Trained Fighter

properties.shortdesc: War veterans, gang members with military experience or nobles who spent a fair share of...

012-cipactli.description: Cipactli are the alleged offspring of a reptilian river god feared for his boundless rage. They roam mangrove forests and tropical river banks in packs, behaving very territorial and highly aggressive towards any kind of encroachment. Their social behaviour is suprisingly complex, with them displaying their martial skills through ritualized combat among each other. However, if isolated from its pack, a Cipactli can form an equally strong bond with any creature able to gain the Cipactli's respect by demonstrating superior prowess. Indigenous tribes have been observed utilizing bonded Cipactli as status symbols, as well as beasts of burden or instruments of war. Tribal legends tell of champions riding into battle mounted on a rampaging Cipactli, battering aside enemies and jungle trees alike in a display of rage worthy of their eponymous genitor.
012-cipactli.name: Cipactli

properties.shortdesc: Cipactli are the alleged offspring of a reptilian river god feared for his boundless rage.

013-harpyia.description: Not many a  creature is as unjustly feared and detested as the Harpyia. Decried as carriers of bad omen, death and evil magic, they have been hunted to near extinction. The remaining Harpyies prefer to nest on storm-wreathed cliffsides and within coastal ravines, seeking safety in isolation. Legend has them born from wind and water, which might explain their affinity to the sea. Colonies, or *parliaments*, of Harpyies can be often found nesting atop the salt-encrusted masts and rigging of beached shipwrecks. This behaviour unfortunately further feeds the hate and fear towards them, as they stand accused of gloating over the misfortune of others, when in reality Harpyies are inclined to protect shipwrecked sailors from actual malicious creatures like the alluring Sirens.
013-harpyia.name: Harpyia

properties.shortdesc: Not many a creature is as unjustly feared and detested as the Harpyia.

014-dragon.description: The Dragon might be the ultimate mythical creature. Almost every human culture has a being with the shared traits of a snake-like body, mighty wings, supernatural cunning and indomitable might. In some myths and folktales they are benevolent and wise, in most they are cruel and despotic. Our dragon makes no attempt at being an ambivalent creature, skirting the border of good and evil or trying to paint the picture of a complex and often misunderstood creature. This dragon is a scaled tyrant, a megalomaniacal lizard corrupted by the arcane energies flowing through its veins. It is avaricious, gluttonous, wrathful and treacherous - the worst traits humanity can offer, but enabled by inhabiting a body of a living and breathing natural disaster.
014-dragon.name: Dragon

properties.shortdesc: The Dragon might be the ultimate mythical creature.

015-werewolf.description: The Wulfen Curse is an affliction of the soul. Some humanoids already carry the seed of beasthood with them, nurturing a dark hunger for violence and bloodshed. If they give in to this hunger, the dread curse takes hold, shaping the body in accordance to the soul. Over time the Wulfen comes to detest its humanoid body, the metaphysical affliction of the soul mirrored in the physical realm. They are, however, forever trapped between worlds, for they are neither wolf nor man, but a chimeric soul burdened with an appetite for both the chase and the catch.
015-werewolf.name: Werewolf

properties.shortdesc: The Wulfen Curse is an affliction of the soul.

016-wolf.description: Wolves are natures way of reminding humans that their superiority extends only as far as their city walls. Those who still venture forth into the frontiers are wise to fear the wolf, the grey-haired and yellow-eyed incarnation of the hunt. Many tribal cultures worship the wolf as totem animals, venerating them as bringers of swift death and cunning hunters, as well as symbols of unity and cohesion.
016-wolf.name: Wolf

properties.shortdesc: Wolves are natures way of reminding humans that their superiority extends only as far...

016-wolfkin.description: Those afflicted by the Curse of the Wulfen slowly lose themselves to the bestial urges festering within their soul. After each hunt it gets harder to take on human form and even the horrid shape of the man-wolf becomes difficult to maintain. Soon the Wolfkin have all but forgotten what it means to be human and fully dedicate themselves to the hunt. Bigger, stronger and blessed with a remaining spark of malicious intellect, Wolfkin soon find themselves in charge of a pack of regular wolves, often answering the call of other hunting Wulfen, eager to redden their maw in the ensuing bloodbath.
016-wolfkin.name: Wolfkin

properties.shortdesc: Hunts alongside Wolves and Werewolves alike.

017-dwarven_king.description: Dwarven Kings do not rule by birthright alone, but command respect earned by dilligence, grit and merit. Dwarves are a proud and stubborn folk and while they appreciate the rigid structures of monarchy, they need a reason for why a specific individual should hold the power to rule the grand cave cities, vast mountain halls and stalwart hill fortresses of dwarvenkind. However, if an aspirant to the throne manages to endure the ordeals and rites necessary to claim the title of king, their subjects serve them with unwavering loyalty. Each Dwarven King is a statesman, general and master craftsman with a body of granite, a soul of iron and a heart of gold.
017-dwarven_king.name: Dwarven King

properties.shortdesc: Dwarven Kings do not rule by birthright alone, but command respect earned by...

018-giant_spider.description: Based on your disposition towards spiders in general, a confrontation with Megaarachnids can range from unpleasant to traumatising. They are vicious predators who are dangerous when you see them, as they can unexpectedly cross surprising distances with mighty leaps, but infinitively more dangerous if you don't, as they excel at lurking in the shadows while waiting in their web, eager to strike as their prey becomes more and more entangled. Megaarachnids usually hunt alone or in small packs to take down bigger prey, but are also known to band together in vast colonies, occupying claustrophobic burrows or abandoned structures, creating a web-covered and egg-filled nightmare realm littered with the dried out husks of their victims.
018-giant_spider.name: Weblurker Arachnid

properties.shortdesc: Based on your disposition towards spiders in general, a confrontation with...

019-reef_keeper.description: Reef Keepers manifest around hydrothermal vents and venture the sea bed in search of untouched subnautic ecosystems like lush coral reefs or kelp forests, where they guard the native lifeforms against invasive species or destructive unnatural forces. Their true form is hard to discern, as they are overgrown with a thick crust of mineral-rich sediment. This crust acts both as natural armor, as well as a rich source of nutrients for nearby flora and fauna. Reef Keepers are usually docile, but if they consider their chosen protectorate endangered they make use of a vast arsenal of exotic defensive capabilities
019-reef_keeper.name: Reef Keeper

properties.shortdesc: Reef Keepers manifest around hydrothermal vents and venture the sea bed in search of...

020-grimgheist.description: Grimgheists are soul-constructs fashioned from murderous and vengeful souls by particularly ruthless practicers of dark and forbidden arts. Driven by an innate thirst for murder and furtherly incited by their creators, the Grimgheist are tasked to either haunt a specific target or to just wreak havoc among the enemies of its master. As they can effortlessly travel between the profane and the ethereal world, they make for efficient assassins, being able to materialize infront of their hapless target and unleash horrible acts of violence upon it, fueled by pure hatred for the living.
020-grimgheist.name: Grimgheist

properties.shortdesc: Grimgheists are soul-constructs fashioned from murderous and vengeful souls by...

021-ghoul_wretchling.description: The scratching and scrawling noises of Ghoul Wretchlings in the walls and under the floor boards herald an incoming Ghoul Invasion. In the following nights people disappear from the streets or the safety of their homes, overwhelmed and paralyzed by  swarms of the scrawny Ghoul Wretchlings, before being dragged to the underground lairs as nourishment for the advancing main force of Ghoulish invaders.
021-ghoul_wretchling.name: Ghoul Wretchling

properties.shortdesc: The scratching and scrawling noises of Ghoul Wretchlings in the walls and under the...

022-orc_shaman.description: Shamans are the spiritual leaders of an orc warhost. They maintain the moral of the troops by conducting bonding rituals and are generally tasked with a wide array of ceremonial duties. Even though they are feared and respected, Shamans often are outsiders, as their reclusive nature and connection to the spiritual world warps them into capricious eccentrics. Most Shamans are not bound to any host, as their true loyalty lies with the shamanistic covens they belong to, often only supporting a host chief when their reign of terror furthers the Shamans own, often concealed, agenda. In combat, Shamans are fearsome opponents who may call upon forces of nature to bring their enemies to their knees. They are able to call upon aid from beyond the Graves and inspire the troops surrounding them to fight even harder, as they feel their ancestor's gaze upon them.
022-orc_shaman.name: Orc Shaman

properties.shortdesc: Shamans are the spiritual leaders of an orc warhost.

023-orc_warchief.description: The Warchief is the single greatest authority within the ranks of a war host - an inspiring, or at least intimidating, leader, a successful commander and a powerful warrior. If they set foot onto a battlefield, their troops throw themselves every more recklessly at the enemy ranks, seeking the approval of their sovereign. Every trace of weakness must purged and every defeat could spell doom for an aspiring conqueror. This realisation often leaves War Chiefs paranoid and choleric, while their constant need to prove their might and tactical acumen drives them to ever greater bloodshed and destruction.
023-orc_warchief.name: Orc Warchief

properties.shortdesc: The Warchief is the single greatest authority within the ranks of a war host - an...

024-kentauros.description: Where the azure sky and the lush green of viridian grasslands meet, the Centaurs reign without equal. They are the undisputed lords of vast plains, steppes, taigas or savannahs. Being nomadic and reclusive, most live in tribal herd-clans, eternally roaming the sacred lands of their forebearers. But there are tales from the eastern fringes, describing hordes of Kentauroi coming together under the banners of a Great Khan, blocking out the skies with thousands of arrows and grinding villages, armies and fortress gates into the dust below their hooves.
024-kentauros.name: Centaur

properties.shortdesc: Highly mobile, deadly archer and powerful charger.

025-trained_archer.description: Ranger, hunters or City guards standing watch on battlements or rooftops - the Trained Archer is a stand-in for every man and woman well versed in the art of the bow. They are capable sharpshooters and can be relied upon in the heat of battle, an ambush or even an assassination. With the weaker members of a party threatened with a barrage of arrows, an organized unit of Trained Archers makes for a flexible and deadly force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
025-trained_archer.name: Trained Archer

properties.shortdesc: Capable sharpshooters and can be relied upon in every situation.

026-vampire_spawn.description: Everlasting mist floods the land of Barovia, the cursed realm of Strahd von Zahrovich. Barovia teems with dreadful creatures, most of which are hellbent on making the player's stay in their realm a harrowing one. For Spooktober 2021 we decided to give the iconic Vampire Spawns roaming the crypts and castles of Curse of Strahd a unique spin! The Barovian Vampire spawn is closely bonded to Strahd, who is the land himself, as we all know! This is reflected by increased mental stats and a strange symbiotic relationship with the mist that wreathes it's masters domain, granting a formidable foe even more power and making for a creature able to haunt even veteran players' nightmares!
026-vampire_spawn.name: Vampire Spawn

properties.shortdesc: Everlasting mist floods the land of Barovia, the cursed realm of Strahd von Zahrovich.

027-revenant_knight.description: The once great Knights of the Order are tragic figures, rust-flaked shades of their former selves, filled only with poisobous thoughts of vengeance and seething hatred. Our Revenant Knight is a tribute to the fallen Order of the Silver Dragon and leans more heaviliy into the tragic nobility of an undead order of Dragon-sworn Knights, with the icy essence of Argynvost still clinging to their ruined armour, in a desperate attempt to shield them from harm even in death. The lingering soul of the Silver Dragon still permeates his brothers in arms, empowering them in dynamic and unique ways.
027-revenant_knight.name: Revenant Knight

properties.shortdesc: The once great Knights of the Order are tragic figures, rust-flaked shades of their...

028-unchained_armor.description: The second-to-last entry of our spooky tribute to our favourite vampire-centric D&D 5e module is here! The rattlinf of chains and metallic cling-clang noises coming from the basement where no illusion, as the big bads own suit of armor has come alive to terrorize nosey parties disturbing the slumber of its master. With lightning surging through the unholy metal and the aforementioned chains eagerly dangling from its black-iron frame, our interpretation if the animated armor is even more vicious than the orignal!
028-unchained_armor.name: Unchained Armor

properties.shortdesc: The second-to-last entry of our spooky tribute to our favourite vampire-centric D&D 5e...

029-infernal_steed.description: This equine nightmare enjoys soaring through the nightly sky, terrorizing local villagers in their very, very flammable homes and (sometimes literally) booting uppity adventurers from its masters castle.
029-infernal_steed.name: Infernal Steed

properties.shortdesc: This equine nightmare enjoys soaring through the nightly sky, terrorizing local...

030-commoner_female.description: Commoners are salt of the earth people inhabiting the various hamlets, villages, hovels and huts strewn around any country, kingdom or frontier. They can be barbers, bakers, bar- or beekeepers, hard working and tax paying folks that may welcome adventurers with open arms into the midst of their society or keep a keen eye on any outsider encroaching on their territory, threatening to make the rapidly shortening remainder of their lives more interesting.
030-commoner_female.name: Commoner Female Priest

properties.shortdesc: Commoners are salt of the earth people inhabiting the various hamlets, villages, hovels...

030-commoner_male.description: Commoners are salt of the earth people inhabiting the various hamlets, villages, hovels and huts strewn around any country, kingdom or frontier. They can be barbers, bakers, bar- or beekeepers, hard working and tax paying folks that may welcome adventurers with open arms into the midst of their society or keep a keen eye on any outsider encroaching on their territory, threatening to make the rapidly shortening remainder of their lives more interesting.
030-commoner_male.name: Commoner Male Worker

properties.shortdesc: Commoners are salt of the earth people inhabiting the various hamlets, villages, hovels...

031-swarm_of_vampire_bats.description: Except as a carrier of disease, a single bat does not usually pose much of a challenge for both fledgling and seasoned adventurers. But add a few hundred or even thousand bats, and you're suddenly confronted with a shrieking inferno of razor claws and pointy teeth, able to gnaw any humanoid the meat from its bones by sheer mass of bodies. Now, regular swarms of bats normally don't show signs of aggression towards beings larger than their insect prey. But in a world steeped in dark magic and beset by evil forces, bats can become dangerous creatures, revelling in a vampiric nature normally only shown by a few select subspecies of bats. These bloodthirsty swarms of bats darken the moonlight sky with ominous intent and are said to only leave drained husks in their wake...
031-swarm_of_vampire_bats.name: Swarm of Vampire Bats

properties.shortdesc: Except as a carrier of disease, a single bat does not usually pose much of a challenge...

032-night_hag.description: Night Hags are vile creatures, once proud denizens of the fae wild who's cruel inclinations got them banished to the Grey Wastes, an ever-gloomy hellscape out in the Far Realms. Not that it matters, for they are able to plane shift to freely spread their very own flavour of chaos, obsession and corruption by poisoning creatures dreams, driving them mad and eventually collecting their souls. Of course, we made some adjustments to the original creature, giving her two additional nightmarish abilities!
032-night_hag.name: Night Hag

properties.shortdesc: Night Hags are vile creatures, once proud denizens of the fae wild who's cruel...

033-yeti.description: Yetis are a chimeric breed, carrying an accumulation of odd traits from their ancestors. Who exactly those ancestors were is unclear, but the Yeti's immunity to even magical cold that far exceeds any natural resistances, as well as their regenerative healing abilites seem to imply a shared heritage based upon both the blood of Frost Giants as well as Trolls. How this unholy alliance came to pass remains mercifully unknown, but it is terrifying nonetheless.
033-yeti.name: Yeti

properties.shortdesc: Yetis are a chimeric breed, carrying an accumulation of odd traits from their ancestors.

034-war_troll.description: Despite Trolls not being particularly sociable, someone just went ahead and recruited some into his merry band of raiders. The prospect of loot and food might have been enough, but no honest Troll would ever pass up the chance to deal out some unchecked violence as well. Thanks to that brave and creative individual more and more bandit leaders, orc war chiefs or mercenary captains managed to coax one of the hulking brutes into joining their venture. These War-Trolls are a tad more intelligent than their truly feral kin and, if drilled correctly, will even follow basic orders. A well trained and experienced War-Troll is truly dangerous, as it knows to efficiently apply its devastating strength to crush its enemies with ease.
034-war_troll.name: War Troll

properties.shortdesc: Despite Trolls not being particularly sociable, someone just went ahead and recruited...

035-roc.description: To describe Rocs as 'gigantic birds of prey' is accurate but vastly understates the horror of a creature able to carry off a fully grown elephant in its talons. They are both profane and mythical in nature, dominating their realm due to their sheer size alone, without any magical or primordial powers coursing through them. They are able to adapt to nearly any environment, causing regional differences in their appearance, as evidenced by sightings of vividly coloured tropical Rocs, as well as arctic variants with frost-wreathed pinions, preying on Yetis and Mammoths.
035-roc.name: Roc

properties.shortdesc: To describe Rocs as 'gigantic birds of prey' is accurate but vastly understates the...

036-winter_empress.description: The Winter Empress is a fey creature, the regent of a frost-wreathed realm of eternal ice. She is an ambitious monarch and often has her court venture out into the realm of man to bring unnatural winter in their wake. Although some claim to have bested or even slain her, tales of her defeat are often followed by even more frigid devastation at the hands of the vengeful queen of ice. With the utterly devoted Knights of Winter sworn to her service, she is considered one of the most enigmatic, yet powerful of the fair lords and ladies.
036-winter_empress.name: Winter Empress

properties.shortdesc: The Winter Empress is a fey creature, the regent of a frost-wreathed realm of eternal ice.

037-royal_griffon.description: Since ages past, the Griffon has been a symbol of just and virtuos regency, earning their species the prefix 'royal'. Because of this symbolism, Royal Griffons are coveted mounts and familiars for any ambitious sovereign. Taming a feral Griffon is a dangerous and arduous undertaking, therefore most trained Griffons originate from Heralds Aerie, a mountain bastion held by an Order of Knights dedicated to forging a bond between a Griffon and its rider.
037-royal_griffon.name: Royal Griffon

properties.shortdesc: Since ages past, the Griffon has been a symbol of just and virtuos regency, earning...

038-arcane_incursor.description: Arcane Incursors resemble interplanar trapdoor spiders, as they burrow into the veil between worlds where they are lying wait, only to burst forth from their lair if magic weakens the border between planes. Once the incursion is completed, they begin their hunt for raw arcane energy, usually starting with the unlucky caster of the spell that lured the Incursor into their world. Arcane Incursors usually hunt alone, but a sufficiently great source of magic might draw more specimens, marking the beginning of an infestation with catastrophic prospects for the local mage population.
038-arcane_incursor.name: Arcane Incursor

properties.shortdesc: Arcane Incursors resemble interplanar trapdoor spiders, as they burrow into the veil...

039-elder_curseroot.description: There are many different Curseroots. Some are small, creeping vines and lumps of moss insidious in nature, some are looming and outright violent, thick-rooted and towering trees, roaring with anger. They are tainted plantlife, sprouted from evil seeds spread by a cursed tree. If even a single Cursewood is found, whole forests must be put to the torch, as the corruption spreads quickly and sometimes even a lone acorn may grow into an unfathomable evil.
039-elder_curseroot.name: Elder Curseroot

properties.shortdesc: There are many different Curseroots.

040-ossian_debt_collector.description: The Debt Collectors are operatives of the Ossian Bank, tasked with tracking and retrieving especially elusive debtors. Despite their harrowing appearance, Ossian Debt Collectors are courteous and sophisticated negotiators, blessed with the endless patience of the undead and prodigious language skills. When approaching a debtor, they initially aim on settling things amicably, politely asking the transient debtor to accompany them to the Ossian Bank to stand before the Tribunal. When met with unreasonableness or hostility, the Debt Collectors begrudgingly change tactics in favour of more direct means of apprehension. It is unclear if their skeletal appearance reflects a Collector's true being or if it only appears as such to their targets, combining two of the things mortals fear most: death and tax collectors.
040-ossian_debt_collector.name: Ossian Debt Collector

properties.shortdesc: The Debt Collectors are operatives of the Ossian Bank, tasked with tracking and...

041-elephant.description: Elephants are intelligent, social and awe-inspiring creatures inhabiting savannahs, jungles and deserts of countless realms. Many cultures consider them sacred, recognizing the gentle soul of a towering, but kind creature through their caring eyes. Elephants can coexist with many different folks, acting as support for the workforce or as devastating living siege weapons in warfare. Killing wild elephants however may draw the ire of its relatives and enraged elephants are able to tear down a settlement brick by brick, if so inclined.
041-elephant.name: Elephant

properties.shortdesc: Elephants are intelligent, social and awe-inspiring creatures inhabiting savannahs...

042-mournbride.description: Mournbrides are the tortured souls of women dying a violent death on what was promised to be the happiest day of their lifes: their wedding day. Great tragedy usually surrounds a Mournbride's ermergence, like murder at the hands of a jealous rival or the taking of ones own life after being left at the altar. Still wrapped in the tattered and blood splattered remains of their wedding gowns, Mournbrides haunt places of great significance to the departed individual, like their family home, wedding venue or secret a meeting place with their former beloved. If their would-be spouse is still alive, the Mournbride will jealously watch over them, often causing more harm than good in their twisted need to protect them.
042-mournbride.name: Mournbride

properties.shortdesc: Mournbrides are the tortured souls of women dying a violent death on what was promised...

043-mind_golem.description: Mind golems are enforcer-creatures crafted by Wizard councils, a mighty body shaped from synthetic flesh imbued with a powerful vat-grown brain, designed to contain the councils Mindmeld. A Mindmeld is psychic amalgamation of the wizards intellect and arcane potential, directly channeling their might and will into their creation, allowing it to act more independently than other forms of golems. Their fused psyches birth new independent thought slaved to their will, which makes Mind golems highly intelligent and capable of stratetic planning and tactical acumen. This, paired with their enourmous strength and innate magic abilities, makes for a truly dangerous living weapon, capable of completing the most daring operations for their masters.
043-mind_golem.name: Mind Golem

properties.shortdesc: Highly intelligent, wields powerful magic and psychic abilities.

044-amygdalyan.description: Amygdalyan are predators from beyond the thin veil separating reality from the infinite ocean of madness beyond. They are drawn to trauma and tragedy like moths to a flame, first appearing in the dreams of their chosen victim, before infiltrating their mind, driving their hosts to bouts of insanity and paranoia before destroying their psyche and moving on, their perverse hunger seated for the time being. If cornered, an Amygdalyan is a cunning and perfidioius foe, using it enemies' greatest fears against them and until they perish from the strain the constant terror puts on their body and mind.
044-amygdalyan.name: Amygdalyan

properties.shortdesc: Planar predator feasting on fear.

045-shattermaw.description: Shattermaws are colossal bad-tempered monstrosities clad in nearly impenetrable osteodermic armour, consisting of bone knobs, plates and spine-like outgrows. Despite their turtle-like appearance, they appear to be an evolutionary offshoot of semi-aquatic sharks. Their thick leathery skin mirrors the swamp-green of their habitat and their cragged shells and bone protrusions become eventually overgrown by moss, algae and lichens, making Shattermaws surprisingly difficult to notice. Their diet consists of everything unlucky enough to wander in front of its eponymous maw, supplemented by anything barely resembling actual prey - including mossy logs, mid-sized boulders or small vehicles. This leads to swamps and river banks within Shattermaw territory being lined with the wreckage of skiffs or rafts displaying their signature corrosive bite marks.
045-shattermaw.name: Shattermaw

properties.shortdesc: Shattermaws are colossal bad-tempered monstrosities clad in nearly impenetrable...

046-garghoul.description: A variant form of the common Ghoul, its tattered wings making it capable of flight. After nightfall, GarGhouls stalk the skies. They are to locate worthwile prey, alerting their swarm upon discovery. As one, the GarGhouls descend, paralyzing their victims with their bite before carrying them off into the dark. If acting as part of a larger force of Ghouls under the command of a higher Ghoul unlifeform, GarGhouls often form the second wave of a larger invasion, using their maddening screams to disorient their terrified victims, before the main force emerges from their hidden dwellings. Swarms of GarGhouls also patrol the vast caverns of the subterran Ghoul realms, seeking out intruders and calling their pale brethren to join them in their feast.
046-garghoul.name: Garghoul

properties.shortdesc: A variant form of the common Ghoul, its tattered wings making it capable of flight.

047-swifttalon_raptor.description: Lithe pack hunters often found in the wake of larger predators to get a few bites in themselves.
047-swifttalon_raptor.name: Swifttalon Raptor

properties.shortdesc: Lithe pack hunters often found in the wake of larger predators to get a few bites in...

048-stormwyvern.description: An especially powerful Blue dragon can infuse a wyvern with its arcane draconic energy, elevating it to a Stormwyvern. Stormwyverns are bestowed a semblance of their master's elemental affinity and cunning. They serve in the dragon's forces as heralds and subcommanders, their increased intelligence allowing for a rudimentary grasp on the draconic language and a crude understanding of battle tactics.
048-stormwyvern.name: Stormwyvern

properties.shortdesc: An especially powerful Blue dragon can infuse a wyvern with its arcane draconic energy...

049-poisonfang.description: Versatile snake-themed assassins utilizing venomous blades, noxious gas, shapeshifting and hypnosis.
049-poisonfang.name: Poisonfang Assassin

properties.shortdesc: Versatile snake-themed assassins utilizing venomous blades, noxious gas, shapeshifting...

050-amber_idol.description: Lumbering colossus capable of absorbing and releasing spells.
050-amber_idol.name: Amber Idol

properties.shortdesc: Lumbering colossus capable of absorbing and releasing spells.

051-toxic_gobbler.description: A very playful and curious critter, yet extremey poisonous. Interactions often result in unintended fatalities.
051-toxic_gobbler.name: Toxic Gobbler

properties.shortdesc: A very playful and curious critter, yet extremey poisonous.

052-wendigo.description: Highly mobile and extremely dangerous, focuses single targets to kill, feast, retreat and repeat.
052-wendigo.name: Wendigo

properties.shortdesc: Highly mobile and extremely dangerous, focuses single targets to kill, feast, retreat...

053-magmatic_coreborn.description: Damaging the rocky hide exposes the superheated core, causing the creature to become more dangerous over time.
053-magmatic_coreborn.name: Magmatic Coreborn

properties.shortdesc: Damaging the rocky hide exposes the superheated core, causing the creature to become...

054-bog_strider.description: Popular mount. Dsorients with a bioluminescent burst, kills by injecting acid and slurping up the liquified remains.
054-bog_strider.name: Bog Strider

properties.shortdesc: Popular mount.

055-klabautermann.description: Serves as a ship's guardian, capable of repelling attackers and bolstering defenders, weaponizes the ship itself.
055-klabautermann.name: Klabautermann

properties.shortdesc: Serves as a ship's guardian, capable of repelling attackers and bolstering defenders...

056-sword_guardian.description: Bodyguard-automaton, receives orders via command rod, adapts to scenarious by switching combat stances.
056-sword_guardian.name: Sword Guardian

properties.shortdesc: Bodyguard-automaton, receives orders via command rod, adapts to scenarious by switching...

057-ridgeback_dunecrawler.description: Titanic crustacean constantly emitting powerful sandstorms, relentlessly pummels opponents using its enormous claws.
057-ridgeback_dunecrawler.name: Ridgeback Dunecrawler

properties.shortdesc: Titanic crustacean constantly emitting powerful sandstorms, relentlessly pummels...

058-vrubel.description: Form abyssal choirs to amplify their harrowing songs, their incessant shrieking capable of driving any soul mad.
058-vrubel.name: Vrubel

properties.shortdesc: Form abyssal choirs to amplify their harrowing songs, their incessant shrieking capable...

059-gladiator_dimachaerus.description: Elegant duellist wielding two blades, excels in single combat against martial opponents.
059-gladiator_dimachaerus.name: Gladiator Dimachaerus

properties.shortdesc: Elegant duellist wielding two blades, excels in single combat against martial opponents.

059-gladiator_murmillo.description: Brutish duellist able to handle multiple opponents at once.
059-gladiator_murmillo.name: Gladiator Murmillo

properties.shortdesc: Brutish duellist able to handle multiple opponents at once.

059-gladiator_retiarius.description: Swift and possibly lethal duellist aiming to topple and immobilize their opponent to deliver critical strikes.
059-gladiator_retiarius.name: Gladiator Retiarius

properties.shortdesc: Swift and possibly lethal duellist aiming to topple and immobilize their opponent to...

060-crazed_reaper.description: Screams incessantly, attacks tirelessly with scythed limbs, otherworldy anger keeps it fighting even in death.
060-crazed_reaper.name: Crazed Reaper

properties.shortdesc: Screams incessantly, attacks tirelessly with scythed limbs, otherworldy anger keeps it...

061-clangorsaurus.description: Batters opponents using its sturdy head and spiked tail club, unleashes frenzied assault upon death.
061-clangorsaurus.name: Clangorsaurus

properties.shortdesc: Batters opponents using its sturdy head and spiked tail club, unleashes frenzied...
