062-pit_abomination.description: Unstable living weapon, barely controlled by its Broodmaster. Unleashes lethal bursts of radiation and electricity.
062-pit_abomination.name: Pit Abomination

properties.shortdesc: Unstable living weapon, barely controlled by its Broodmaster.

062-pit_broodmaster.description: Tends to the Pit Abomination to keep its unstable mutations and deteriorating mind in check.
062-pit_broodmaster.name: Pit Broodmaster

properties.shortdesc: Tends to the Pit Abomination to keep its unstable mutations and deteriorating mind in...

063-beckoning_devil.description: Insidious manipulator, embraces creatures to bring under his thrall, capable of erasing any trace of its existence.
063-beckoning_devil.name: Beckoning Devil

properties.shortdesc: Insidious manipulator, embraces creatures to bring under his thrall, capable of erasing...

064-grey_pilgrim.description: Otherwordly presence manifested as a humanoid pachyderm, acts as a spiritual guide to those who lost their path.
064-grey_pilgrim.name: Grey Pilgrim

properties.shortdesc: Otherwordly presence manifested as a humanoid pachyderm, acts as a spiritual guide to...

065-sovereigns_guard.description: Kings and Queens, Hierophants and Arch-Bishops, Emperors and Empresses - these sovereigns dare not resting their wellbeing on the meek shoulders of regular guards or hired mercenaries. A true sovereign requires an elite guard, drilled fighters of supreme ability and mental strength, eager to continously prove their worth and unwavering loyalty. The Sovereign's Guard represent an elite cadre of bodyguards and combat specialists, well versed in both protecting their liege or carrying out special tasks all over the realm.
065-sovereigns_guard.name: Sovereign's Guard

properties.shortdesc: Elite bodyguard, overcomes grievous injury through sheer devotion,.

066-scorched_legionary.description: Relentlessly advances through billowing ash and ember-smoke, wreathed in primordial fire.
066-scorched_legionary.name: Scorched Legionary

properties.shortdesc: Relentlessly advances through billowing ash and ember-smoke, wreathed in primordial fire.

067-rustmire_gadfly.description: Excels at being annoying; hard to hit and hinders spellcasting due to its constant droning buzz sounds.
067-rustmire_gadfly.name: Rustmire Gadfly

properties.shortdesc: Excels at being annoying; hard to hit and hinders spellcasting due to its constant...

068-wereboar.description: Towering half-boar, usually combining the worst traits of man and swine.
068-wereboar.name: Wereboar

properties.shortdesc: Towering half-boar, usually combining the worst traits of man and swine.

068-wereboar_2.description: Towering half-boar, usually combining the worst traits of man and swine.
068-wereboar_2.name: Wereboar

properties.shortdesc: Towering half-boar, usually combining the worst traits of man and swine.

069-dollmaker_devil.description: Nightmarish puppeteer, fights by turning creatures into paralyzed puppets, cutting their strings on a whim.
069-dollmaker_devil.name: Dollmaker Devil

properties.shortdesc: Fights by turning creatures into paralyzed puppets.

070-airship_sentry_automaton.description: Automated sentries were first utilized during a great exhibition showcasing different proofs of concept concerning the development of techno-arcane automata. These prototypes were expanded upon by military scientists and now serve as sentries and boarding repellents on various airships throughout the realms. Their armaments consist of heavy boarding axes, short-ranged ocular beams and advanced kinetic shielding, all powered by a miniature techno-arcane reactor. These sentries are able to activate a magnetic field, allowing them to safely battle any threats while being mag-locked to an airship's metal hull. Gunner variants are also known to operate the heavy Thunderstrike Pattern Airship Cannons utilized by great military airships, such as the Dawn Emperor and Storm Herald class.
070-airship_sentry_automaton.name: Airship Sentry Automaton

properties.shortdesc: Simple combat automaton, equipped with a occular beam and a heavy boarding axe.

071-blade_slave.description: Humanoid husk torturted into madness, empowered by taking slashing damage while erratically swinging a greatword.
071-blade_slave.name: Blade Slave

properties.shortdesc: Humanoid husk torturted into madness, empowered by taking slashing damage while...

072-slipstream_phaseknife.description: Unstoppable assassin phasing in and out of existence using a complicated slipstream generator.
072-slipstream_phaseknife.name: Slipstream Phaseknife

properties.shortdesc: Unstoppable assassin phasing in and out of existence using a complicated slipstream...

073-gorgeleaper.description: Treetop predator swallowing its prey whole to disgorge it into spawn pools teeming with its flesh-eating tadpoles.
073-gorgeleaper.name: Gorgeleaper

properties.shortdesc: Treetop predator swallowing its prey whole to disgorge it into spawn pools teeming with...

074-undead_pikeman.description: A shambling undead bearing simple arms, capable of withstanding surprising amounts of damage without complaining.
074-undead_pikeman.name: Undead Pikeman

properties.shortdesc: A shambling undead bearing simple arms, capable of withstanding surprising amounts of...

075-guild_artillerist.description: Expert marksman and demolitionist excelling both as part of a firing line or lone operator. Suffers from serious hearing damage.
075-guild_artillerist.name: Guild Artillerist

properties.shortdesc: Expert marksman and demolitionist excelling both as part of a firing line or lone...

076-deathsworn.description: Orc warrior seeking death in honourable combat. Their solemn, yet energetic fighting style resembles a lethal dance.
076-deathsworn.name: Deathsworn

properties.shortdesc: Orc warrior seeking death in honourable combat.

077-necromancer.description: Necromancers are magic users who pursued the arcane arts beyond the restrictions that nature and mortality place upon less curious souls. Death is a strong metaphysical concept and those tapping into the domain of biological and metaphysical death quickly find themselves swelling with power, as they carry life into the realms of death to reanimate bodies or manipulate souls, or invite death into the realms of the living, turning flesh to dust and withering body and soul. This power quickly corrupts and many societies fear, shun or hunt those who passed the treshold and invited death into their life.
077-necromancer.name: Necromancer

properties.shortdesc: Necromancers are magic users who pursued the arcane arts beyond the restrictions that...

078-necrovolt_circuitslave.description: Circuitslaves are burned-out husks powered by the abyssal energies of the Netherstorm. Through the shapeless Necrovolt, a being of sentient lightning accidentally created and worshipped by the Reanimator Conclaves, they are connected to their masters in a cursed circuit, living lightning coursing continously coursing through them. They eternally hunger for more energy, seeking out living creatures to drain their bodies of it.
078-necrovolt_circuitslave.name: Necrovolt Circuitslave

properties.shortdesc: Circuitslaves are burned-out husks powered by the abyssal energies of the Netherstorm.

078-necrovolt_reanimator.description: The Necrovolt Reanimators are a conclave of deranged scientists who discovered the abyssal Netherstorm, a sentient tempest of howling souls, charged with cracking aether-lightning. Reanimators harness the Netherstorm's boundless energy with their Necrovoltaic Generators, using it to power various nightmarish machineries and undead constructs. Over time fanatical members of the Reanimator Conclave seemingly discerned sentience within their own devices, remnants of the soul-lightning powering them. This ghost in the machine was dubbed the Necrovolt, a being of unliving lightning made manifest.
078-necrovolt_reanimator.name: Necrovolt Reanimator

properties.shortdesc: The Necrovolt Reanimators are a conclave of deranged scientists who discovered the...

079-mummy.description: Ages ago Ankh was ruled by ancient god-beasts, forcing their subjects to conquer a vast empire in their name. The surrounding realms where powerless against the god-beasts otherworldly might and divine wrath and soon an empire was carved from bone, blood and sand with mighty monuments of worship rising from the desert ground wherever the slave-armies of Ankh marched. The god-beasts were cast down using the cthonian Duat Blades, their wielders were lauded as heroes and ruled Ankh for ages, their lifespan unnaturally extended by the cursed blades. As they eventually died, they would rise again and reclaim their blades, their embalmed and mummified bodies serving as hollow vessels for the energies of the Duat. Legions of shambling mummies follow in their wake, once more called to war by their queens and princes, now waging war on their own erstwhile kin-blood.
079-mummy.name: Mummy

properties.shortdesc: Ages ago Ankh was ruled by ancient god-beasts, forcing their subjects to conquer a vast...

080-sharakhul.description: Ages ago, the great dragon Sharakhul fell victim to a hive of Mind Tyrants, a psionically gifted race of subterran conquerers and slavers. Seeking a new vessel for their abominable hive mind, they spend decades torturing the dragon into submission, bent on erasing his spirit, originally intent on leaving the body intact. But the great dragon resisted and as punishment they psychically flayed him, stripping away his indomitable scales and reducing his form to a mass of undulating flesh.His body flayed and defiled, his mind fractured in unmendable ways, the broken husk of Sharakhul rose from the depths and sought exile, pouring himself into foul methods of blood magic in a desperate attempt to mend his flesh and restore his scales
080-sharakhul.name: Sharakhul

properties.shortdesc: Ages ago, the great dragon Sharakhul fell victim to a hive of Mind Tyrants, a...

081-crusader.description: Crusaders are chosen warriors infused with holy purpose, traveling the lands to retrieve lost relics, protect priests and pilgrims or enact divine judgement against sworn enemies of their patron saint or deity. They are singular in devotion, trained in the arts of war from a young age and eager to prove their worthiness at any cost.
081-crusader.name: Crusader

properties.shortdesc: Crusaders are chosen warriors infused with holy purpose, traveling the lands to...

082-shell_sage.description: Shell-Sages wander the lands oblivious to possible danger, protected only by their trusty shell, sheer legendary luck and the hesitation of possible predators, as their would-be prey moves through their territory with confusing self-assuredness and tranquility. Shell-Sages owe their title to the habit of withdrawing into the safety of their eponymous shell, spending days and even weeks in deep contemplation, from which they they only awake due to the excitement experienced by stumbling upon especially profound insights. Wild animals or curious people are drawn to the shell, listening to the calming, mumbled utterances echoing from within the shell.
082-shell_sage.name: Shell Sage

properties.shortdesc: Shell-Sages wander the lands oblivious to possible danger, protected only by their...

083-hydra.description: The Hydra is an ancient nightmare given form, coiling serpent heads, their curved fangs dripping with lethal poison and a towering reptile body capable of moving with unsettling grace - there is nothing about the Hydra that does not evoke vivid imagery and primal fears whenever its name is whispered. Hydrae are dangerous to hunt, as even a mortally wounded beast might return after only days have passed and whole swathes of land have been put to the torch to drive such a monstrosity from its lair and finally put an end to it.
083-hydra.name: Hydra

properties.shortdesc: The Hydra is an ancient nightmare given form, coiling serpent heads, their curved fangs...

084-mimic.description: It is unclear how exactly Mimics came to be. The leading theory proposes that a Wizard sought a way to secure his riches and enchanted a chest to simply make it come alive and eat intruders, which, knowing wizards, does not seem too far-fetched. How we ended up with the voracious ambush predators taking all manner of shapes or for ms still poses some unanswered questions. Similarly, unclear is how Mimics reproduce, even if the thought of pocket-sized chests with big eyes is delightful. Some theorize that Mimic eggs eerily resemble gold coins, allowing Mimics to mix their brood into the treasures they guard.
084-mimic.name: Mimic

properties.shortdesc: It is unclear how exactly Mimics came to be.

085-aberrant_tyrant.description: Aberrant Tyrants birth themselves into the Material Plane through their dreams and nightmares. Considering themselves the apex of creation, an Aberrant Tyrant's worst nightmare is to be trapped in a world filled with inferior creatures. Due to the nature of the dreamlands beyond the veil, these nightmares are manifested, and the Tyrant is brought forth into the mundane world, where it promptly goes mad from the combined horrors of this experience and the utter contempt towards the vile inhabitants of this hellscape. Some Tyrants however dream of subjugating foreign worlds their inhabitants, only to wake up finally being able to do so. They are, however, no less insane.
085-aberrant_tyrant.name: Aberrant Tyrant

properties.shortdesc: Aberrant Tyrants birth themselves into the Material Plane through their dreams and...

086-fire_manifestation.description: Fire Manifestations a living blazes inhabiting the ever-burning plane of Eternal Fire. Into this ash-choked realm of red sand and molten rock retreated the primordial beings of flame once the immense magic potential necessary to feed them slowly bled from the young world's bones into the beings of flesh and blood that slowly came to inhabit and shape it. The Manifestations are personified elemental forces, fire's unsatiable hunger and destructive nature given flickering form. In the profane world, Manifestations flock to places connected to their native plane or appear in the wake of fire-related disasters powerful enough to tear through the veil between planes.
086-fire_manifestation.name: Fire Manifestation

properties.shortdesc: Fire Manifestations a living blazes inhabiting the ever-burning plane of Eternal Fire.

087-wintergrim.description: Sudden drops in temperature and billowing snowstorms herald the coming of a Wintergrim. Wintergrim are murderous fey creatures and intrude into the profane world during a time where the temperature drops to unnatural lows and the snow mantle becomes a burial shroud for humans and livestock alike. Hunters don't return from the forest, rime coats windows and even a fire's heat may no longer banish the exisential cold that has seeped into body and spirit. Until banished by the return of spring, the Wintergrim will hunt, its pale bestial hands choking life and and warmth from its victims, leaving behind only icy skin and blood on the snow. At the seasonal height of its power, even powerful iron wards may not keep a Wintergrim at bay and many a frontier village turns to ancient pacts sealed with blood and sacrifice instead.
087-wintergrim.name: Wintergrim

properties.shortdesc: Sudden drops in temperature and billowing snowstorms herald the coming of a Wintergrim.

088-magarach_sentinel.description: Magarach were created as an ancient warrior caste to serve the formless Waking One as temple guardians, but were abandoned by their creator. With the Magarach still tending to overgrown vestiges of past glory, nature has reclaimed the once thriving temple complexes and the Magarach, blessed with the right to bathe within the sacred waters they guard, are granted longevity bordering on immortality. The Magarach protect these hidden wells, as within the sacred waters the essence of the Waking One still lingers on. Upon death, a Magarach's soul returns to these wells and it will soon rise once more, accumulating hundreds of lifetimes worth of experience, knowledge and grudges over the centuries..
088-magarach_sentinel.name: Magarach Sentinel

properties.shortdesc: Magarach were created as an ancient warrior caste to serve the formless Waking One as...

089-berserker.description: Berserkers are chosen warriors who rejected a normal life and embraced the savage nature of the Bear. Giving in to the totemic spirit they were transformed, taking on the form of the great Beast from which they draw their otherworldly strenghs. Either as nomadic sages or part of a group of warriors they seek glory and adventure, tightly wrapped by the strings of fate - a Berserker is sure to either become a scourge upon the land or a fabled folk hero, there is no room for mediocrity.
089-berserker.name: Berserker

properties.shortdesc: Berserkers are chosen warriors who rejected a normal life and embraced the savage...

090-swordbearer_reliquary.description: Swordbearer Reliquaries are vestiges of past ages, walking shrines dedicated to a forgotten deity of war and valor. These silent effigies are named Swordbearers, for ancient blades are driven deeply into their craggy form, unclear to which purpose - remembrance or veneration? It is also unknown what causes life to spark within the overgrown form of the Reliquary, causing it to rise and wander. Maybe the souls of the ancient blades thirst for battle once more, or maybe the lost deity itself slowly wakes from its god-slumber, sending out these living shrines as solemn emissaries to seek out worthy warriors to receive the old god's favor.
090-swordbearer_reliquary.name: Swordbearer Reliquary

properties.shortdesc: Swordbearer Reliquaries are vestiges of past ages, walking shrines dedicated to a...

091-guild_heretic.description: Former artisans of the great Powder, Steam and Clockwork guilds disgraced for their continued interest in banned technologies gathered around Rekwyn Gharst, the master artisan often referred to as a heretic. Shunned and in hiding due to their perverse pursuit of Viscerart, a self-coined portmanteau elevating intricate bloodshed and indiscriminate bombings to a controversial artform, the Heretics are a collective of like-minded individuals, continually developing new mechanical abominations, which exist in mockery of the fragility of the humanoid form. Guild Heretics take great pride in their devastating arsenal and each drop of spilled blood is a badge of honour..
091-guild_heretic.name: Guild Heretic

properties.shortdesc: Former artisans of the great Powder, Steam and Clockwork guilds disgraced for their...

092-gargling_headtaker.description: Gargling Headtakers roam shallow waters and coastal regions, inhabiting flooded coves or stranded shipwrecks. They are an unsettling sight, lumbering mancrabs, foam dripping ceaselessly from their strange crustacean mouthparts, unfeeling eyes and wiggling antennas. As they hunt in small packs, their characteristic and disquieting gargling noises used to communicate oftentimes herald an incoming attack. When fighting, the Headtakers make use of their oversized pincers, grasping, impaling or crushing their prey, knowing no difference between man or animal.
092-gargling_headtaker.name: Gargling Headtaker

properties.shortdesc: Gargling Headtakers roam shallow waters and coastal regions, inhabiting flooded coves...

093-faceless.description: Faceless are demons of murder, summoned by ritual and bound to a worldy anchor by its summoner. Faceless tirelessly hunt their prey, unhindered by locks, guards or castle walls. Despite acting independently, each Faceless is an aspect of a greater demonic entity, either unable or unwilling to leave its home plane. This makes Faceless all the more terrifying, as a designated victim oftentimes finds itself harried by a neverending stream of demonic incursions until it finally succumbs to the continuous assaults. A creature targeted by the Faceless can only hope for the summoner's death or to evade its own demise long enough to wear out the patience of the demon.
093-faceless.name: Faceless

properties.shortdesc: Faceless are demons of murder, summoned by ritual and bound to a worldy anchor by its...

094-skeletal_sapper.description: Skeletal Sappers were devised by the Bonemason Pioneers of the Burial Host. Sappers are driven towards fortified settlements to tear holes into their defenses, allowing the rest to advance through the ruined fortifications. These tactics were quickly adopted by ambitious necromancers and ossian artisans throughout the realms.
094-skeletal_sapper.name: Skeletal Sapper

properties.shortdesc: Skeletal Sappers were devised by the Bonemason Pioneers of the Burial Host.

095-auxiliary_automaton.description: Auxiliary Automata are the next evolutionary step within the field of techno-arcane developments. It is outfitted with an advanced crystalline logic core that allows it to make decisions within a pre-defined perimeter, a sturdy chassis able to withstand considerable damage and gravity defying hover-generators, allowing it to navigate difficult terrain with ease. These prototypes are bristling with experimental weaponry and are designed for boarding actions within the tight confines of Airship corridors, being able to block off parts of the ship with geomantic hard-light barriers or act as a spearhead to breach fortified positions.
095-auxiliary_automaton.name: Auxiliary Automaton

properties.shortdesc: Auxiliary Automata are the next evolutionary step within the field of techno-arcane...

096-coastal_marauder.description: Marauders rely on speed and the element of surprise to overun less fortified and sparsely defended targets like coastal hamlets or monasteries. If met with resistance, the momentum of the attack needs to be upheld at any cost. Independed veteran war bands split off from the main force to hunt down enemy clusters before they can mount an organized defense. As houses go up in flames, the thick smoke covers the retreat back to the ship and onto the open sea..
096-coastal_marauder.name: Coastal Marauder

properties.shortdesc: Marauders rely on speed and the element of surprise to overun less fortified and...

096-stormwrath_marauder.description: Stormwrath Marauders are conduits of the tempest's fury, their heart beating in tact with the rolling thunder. Warriors might be born blessed by the storms or elevated by a higher being that holds command over the elements, such as a Storm Giant, a dragon or even a god. They become chosen warriors, stalwart in their faith and honoured keepers of the naval rites..
096-stormwrath_marauder.name: Stormwrath Marauder

properties.shortdesc: Stormwrath Marauders are conduits of the tempest's fury, their heart beating in tact...

097-hoplite.description: Heavy infantry fighting in unison, shield to shield and with their spears raised they stand against onrushing waves of attackers - regardless the setting, Hoplites fighting in phalanx formation are a powerful image to evoke. As it took more than two thousand years to dethrone the phalanx as the most effective method of ancient warfare, one has to wonder how how effective it might be in a fantasy setting, supported by magic or divine powers.
097-hoplite.name: Hoplite

properties.shortdesc: Heavy infantry fighting in unison, shield to shield and with their spears raised they...

098-knight_of_tragedy.description: Collapsed under the weight of their oaths, these fallen Knights are bound to ruined castles or abandoned chapels. Some sold their souls to protect their brethren, transgressed against their patron saint or broke their oath so severly that it resulted in the total corruption of their being. Whatever the reason for their downfall, these erstwhile epitomes of piety and righteousness have become dark mirrors of their past, now doomed to cause the same pain and suffering they were once sworn to fight. Steeped in tragedy, these Knights are solemn creatures, most harboring the secret desire to die in combat, being finally brought to justice by a righteous blade.
098-knight_of_tragedy.name: Knight of Tragedy

properties.shortdesc: Collapsed under the weight of their oaths, these fallen Knights are bound to ruined...

099-shipbreaker_leviathan.description: Exhibiting highly aggressive behaviour towards sea vessels, this leviathan class monstrosity of proto-reptilian heritage earned the designation -Shipbreaker-. An sentient oceanic predator of terrifying size, the Shipbreaker Leviathan hunts aquatic megafauna, its domain extending from the wave-crested open waters to the crushing hadopelagic depths. Sightings of wounded or slain specimen covered in scars and bitemarks allow a glimpse into the nightmarish realm of the oceanic void, where not even Leviathans are safe from being preyed upon.
099-shipbreaker_leviathan.name: Shipbreaker Leviathan

properties.shortdesc: Exhibiting highly aggressive behaviour towards sea vessels, this leviathan class...

100-luck_dragon.description: In stark contrast to their domineering and tyrannical brethren, these travel sized dragons usually prefer a friendly scratch behind the ears to worship and subjugation. They do not take themselves very seriously and admire this quality in others, known to both form strong bonds of friendship, as well as petty, but well-spirited rivalries. It is unclear if the Luck Dragon's existence implies the existence of a Bad Luck Dragon, but experts argue that regular Dragons could already be considered Bad Luck Dragons.
100-luck_dragon.name: Luck Dragon

properties.shortdesc: In stark contrast to their domineering and tyrannical brethren, these travel sized...

101-stonegorger.description: Stonegorgers are an enigmatic offshoot of giant-kin, lacking the majesty and grandeur of their mythical brethren. Called Skoldborer in their native tongue, fables claim that Stonegorgers devour rock and stone to get to the gems, ores and minerals within in an attempt to reunite their earthen mother with her treasures. Accumulating these precious materials within their bodies, they slowly turn into stone themselves. As they approach the end of their life, they seek ever greater depths, finally succumbing to age and pressure, returning earth's treasures to its womb. The earth welcomes its wayward children back and gracefully accepts the gifts they bring, rewarding the Stonegorger by slowly turning it into a being of pure diamond, in death finally achieving the beauty it always pursued.
101-stonegorger.name: Stonegorger

properties.shortdesc: Stonegorgers are an enigmatic offshoot of giant-kin, lacking the majesty and grandeur...

102-gatebreaker_devil.description: Lacking the subtleness of their more devious kin, Gatebreaker Devils are part of the infernal vanguard, leading the charge upon the event of an incursion, as they charge through the brimstone gates and trample anything in their way. Eager to inflict wrath and violence upon the world, they are often called upon by Diabolists and Summoners to enact violence in their service. As they are lesser devils in that sense that they merely represent an aspect of a sin, rather than holding command over it, they are less likely to intentionally try and corrupt their temporary master.
102-gatebreaker_devil.name: Gatebreaker Devil

properties.shortdesc: Lacking the subtleness of their more devious kin, Gatebreaker Devils are part of the...

103-gloomspore_harvester.description: Gloomspore Harvesters haunt jungles and fungus forests, swamps, subterran groves and even occasionally overgrown City sewers. In dim light, their gaunt upper body resembles a scrawny tree, while it gently shifts its weight between its branch-like six legs, allowing it to silently stride through thick underbrush, as well as crawl-climb through the tree tops. A gentle rain of soft-glowing spores surrounds it, allowing the Harvester to sense its surroundings and infesting living creatures. Each infested creature appears as a radiant beacon to the Harvester, who in turn skulks towards it to harvest its weakened prey's dwindling energy.
103-gloomspore_harvester.name: Gloomspore Harvester

properties.shortdesc: Gloomspore Harvesters haunt jungles and fungus forests, swamps, subterran groves and...

104-bone_host.description: A Bone Host is no single demon, rather a tendril of a multifacteded demonic swarm-being inhabiting one of several host bodies of gnarled bone. This demonic consciousness, resembling a shoal of abyssal energy, is spread over several Bone Hosts, fighting and hunting together in fiendish synchroniCity..
104-bone_host.name: Bone Host

properties.shortdesc: A Bone Host is no single demon, rather a tendril of a multifacteded demonic swarm-being...

105-ogre_mercenary.description: Better armed and more intelligent than their more feral brethren, these hulking henchmen are still known for their insatiable appetite for treasure and their considerable strength, making them a force to be reckoned with. Beneath their brutish exterior lies a mischievous sense of humor that often catches their victims off-guard.
105-ogre_mercenary.name: Ogre Mercenary

properties.shortdesc: Better armed and more intelligent than their more feral brethren, these hulking...

106-equiterrean.description: Equiterreans resemble horses carved from mossy rock, decked with a coat of rich earthy tones, adorned with vibrant greenery and blooming flowers. They are stalwart and gentle beings, channeling the lifegiving powers of earth and sun, mending wounds and restoring vigor. Loyal servants to those having dominion over the earthen aspect of the elemental spheres are often bestowed with such a steed as a boon, but Equiterreans may also choose to accept a worthy being as their rider themselves.
106-equiterrean.name: Equiterrean

properties.shortdesc: Equiterreans resemble horses carved from mossy rock, decked with a coat of rich earthy...

107-trained_mage.description: Trained Mages are not only gifted with arcane potential, but have already taken steps to hone and further develop it. Their stern gaze tells of years of intense study, their confidence of their ability to bend reality to their will. They know what power they hold, what they sacrificed to aquire it and have already set their eyes on gaining more.
107-trained_mage.name: Trained Mage

properties.shortdesc: Trained Mages are not only gifted with arcane potential, but have already taken steps...

108-deathrite_harrower.description: The Deathrite Cult strives for a world silenced by death, an unliving utopia of crypts tended to by the mute Graveswardens. To hush those living beings disturbing the sacred silence of the Deathshroud, the Deathrite's High Crematorians dispatch legions of thralls, both mortal cultists and the Annointed, undead beings bound or birthed into the ranks of the Deathrite. Among these Annointed are the Deathrite Harrowers, hateful souls that gave their life in service of the Deathrite, now carrying a holy mandate to silence the blasphemous beating of hearts and turn all that is living into blessed ash.
108-deathrite_harrower.name: Deathrite Harrower

properties.shortdesc: Moves in silence and summons lethal soulfire.

109-henge_guardian.description: Henge Guardians are ancient constructs carved by shamans from blessed rock, acting as arbiters of peace and bulwarks against intruders from beyond the veil of the mundane world. Within the Guardian reside ancestral spirits of ages past, souls of chiefs, warriors, shamans or figures of importance to the tribesfolk, empowering the towering stonework of their collective body with the desire to protect their kin and continually serve the tribe in death.
109-henge_guardian.name: Henge Guardian

properties.shortdesc: Henge Guardians are ancient constructs carved by shamans from blessed rock, acting as...

110-apshait_ambusher.description: Apshait are named after mythical insects said to feast on the souls of the dead during their travels through the underworld. Those worrying about their immortal soul may be relieved to hear that the actual Apshait much prefer to feast on mortal bodies instead, making them a dangerous prospect for both lone travelers or armed transports traversing infested landscapes. Breeding in looming underground hives, the Asphait's expansive tunnel networks stretch far beyond the central hive chambers, where the Apshait soldier swarms utilize them to coordinate intricate ambushes.
110-apshait_ambusher.name: Apshait Ambusher

properties.shortdesc: Apshait are named after mythical insects said to feast on the souls of the dead during...

111-aerocyte_floatling.description: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like jellyfish slow-dancing on mistral currents. Awe quickly turns into horror as these Airborne parasites attach to organic hosts and begin to inflate, eventually carrying their prey off into the sky. There the bulbous Stratohives float, waiting for their Floatlings to deliver sustenance. Once the hulking specimens have drained the hosts of all biomass, the Floatlings attach to their Stratohive, receiving their equal share. When continuously fed, Floatlings evolve into Stratohive, becoming the host for their own flottilla of Floatlings and beginning the cycle a new.
111-aerocyte_floatling.name: Aerocyte Floatling

properties.shortdesc: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like...

111-aerocyte_floatling_inflated.description: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like jellyfish slow-dancing on mistral currents. Awe quickly turns into horror as these Airborne parasites attach to organic hosts and begin to inflate, eventually carrying their prey off into the sky. There the bulbous Stratohives float, waiting for their Floatlings to deliver sustenance. Once the hulking specimens have drained the hosts of all biomass, the Floatlings attach to their Stratohive, receiving their equal share. When continuously fed, Floatlings evolve into Stratohive, becoming the host for their own flottilla of Floatlings and beginning the cycle a new.
111-aerocyte_floatling_inflated.name: Aerocyte Floatling Inflated

properties.shortdesc: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like...

111-aerocyte_stratohive.description: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like jellyfish slow-dancing on mistral currents. Awe quickly turns into horror as these Airborne parasites attach to organic hosts and begin to inflate, eventually carrying their prey off into the sky. There the bulbous Stratohives float, waiting for their Floatlings to deliver sustenance. Once the hulking specimens have drained the hosts of all biomass, the Floatlings attach to their Stratohive, receiving their equal share. When continuously fed, Floatlings evolve into Stratohive, becoming the host for their own flottilla of Floatlings and beginning the cycle a new.
111-aerocyte_stratohive.name: Aerocyte Stratohive

properties.shortdesc: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like...

112-witherflesh_colossus.description: First created by the expert Fleshgrafters of the Burial Host, an endless column of shambling undead pressed into service by a council of arcane artisans with special interest in the possibilities offered by a staunch rejection of morality and ethics, the Witherflesh Colossi quickly became a staple in the arsenal of aspiring necromancers due to their hulking size, unearthly strength and customizable number of tearing, smashing and crushing limbs. While requiring a considerable starting investment of both necromantic energy and dead meat, the results speak for themselves and an expertly grafted Colossus is worth its weight in (albeit often blood-stained) gold.
112-witherflesh_colossus.name: Witherflesh Colossus

113-facestealer.description: Facestealers are demonic entities that revel in subjecting indiscriminate terror upon mortal beings. Their bulbous insectoid bodies are overgrown with faces and skulls in various states of decomposition, weeping, whispering, laughing or screaming. These are the results of the Facestealer's unique hunting methods, being able to draw creatures into a demonic realm where they are assailed by the Imprisoned Ones, waning shades of the demon's previous victims. If a creature succumbs to the demonic realm, its soul will be devoured by the Facestealer and its face joins the ingrown gallery upon the demon's bloated body.
113-facestealer.name: Facestealer

properties.shortdesc: Facestealers are demonic entities that revel in subjecting indiscriminate terror upon...

113-imprisoned_one.description: The Imprisoned Ones are the echoes of a Facestealer's victims populating the demonic realm lorded over by the demon. Waning shades of past beings consumed by the demonic energies of their captor, they have become part of the insidious process that once claimed their soul.
113-imprisoned_one.name: Imprisoned One

properties.shortdesc: The Imprisoned Ones are the echoes of a Facestealer's victims populating the demonic...

114-minotaur.description: For ages, scholars have been contemplating the origin of the mighty Minotaurs, bovine man-beasts of considerable strength, often exhibiting an inborn lust for battle and an innate understanding of ancient martial traditions. While civilized Minotaurs can be found in the ranks or even upper brass of mercenary bands or royal armies, feral specimens plague untamed lands or cut bloody swathes through frontier regions. Regardless of if they are the cursed children of a bestial progenitor or the products of a war god's special kind of divine intervention, Minotaurs embody mythical prowess in a way few creatures do.
114-minotaur.name: Minotaur

properties.shortdesc: For ages, scholars have been contemplating the origin of the mighty Minotaurs, bovine...

115-pirate_powder_dancer.description: Powder Dancers are part of a pirate ship's dedicated boarding crews, agile and tactically versatile fighters and marksmen well versed in the art of ship to ship combat. They constantly alternate between Melee and ranged weaponry, overwhelming the defenders with devastating point blank salvos from their characteristic flintlock pistols or pressuring them with aggressive bladework. Once the rhythmic, bellowing blasts fade away and the powder dust dissipates, the enemy ship has been taken.
115-pirate_powder_dancer.name: Pirate Powder Dancer

properties.shortdesc: Flavourful pirate, excels at close-quarter gun fights.

116-mawbloom_creepling.description: Creeplings are miniature Mawblooms in an infant stadium. They emerge from underground spawn-pods attached to the Mawbloom's Gravesroots and are the Mawbloom's primary form of reproduction, attaching to unsuspecting targets to drain them of nutrients, before seeking out new territories to become stationary and grow into Voracious Mawblooms themselves.
116-mawbloom_creepling.name: Mawbloom Creepling

properties.shortdesc: Creeplings are miniature Mawblooms in an infant stadium.

116-voracious_mawbloom.description: Cultivated by the arcano-botanists of Ferdeaux as befitting guardians for their sprawling topiaries, the carnivorous Mawblooms boast a towering statue, toothed jaw-petals, growth-accelerated root-vines and acidic digestion glands. What started started out as controlled, if experimental, cultivation has spiraled into an ecological disaster, as the Mawblooms evolved an unintended reproducive method by producing so-called Creeplings. The miniature Mawblooms are capable of uprooting themselves and crawl on unnerving root-legs, extending their reach to explore new territories. Their rapid colonization has led to ecological havoc, as they multiply exponentially, choking out native flora and preying upon local fauna.
116-voracious_mawbloom.name: Voracious Mawbloom

properties.shortdesc: Cultivated by the arcano-botanists of Ferdeaux as befitting guardians for their...

117-skeletal_graveblade.description: Graveblades were capable warriors, their body and soul now enthralled by necromancy powerful enough to restore their martial abilities and fighting spirit. Not to be confused with the mindless shambling hordes of lesser undead they often command, they are creative in the way of using their undead form to their advantage, amplifying their martial strength with the possibilities opened up by an undying body. Their fiery passion and warrior's honour, however, transformed into the cruel coldness of the unliving, turning the Gravesblades into relentless executors of calculated and methodical slaughter.
117-skeletal_graveblade.name: Skeletal Graveblade

properties.shortdesc: Graveblades were capable warriors, their body and soul now enthralled by necromancy...

118-cyclops.description: Cyclopeans are tragic figurs, once the master smiths of giant kind, using their god-given power over the elements to forge storm-wreathed weaponry for the High Kings of the Storm Giants, the Frost Giant Jarls or Stone Giant Thanes. But these days are over, the few Cyclopeans left are pale shades of former glory, lumbering thin-blooded brutes who barely know how to swing their club, let alone a blacksmith's hammer. They are very suspicious, but once their mistrust has been overcome, they are trusting bordering gullibe - perhaps an indication that their downfall has been brought about by betrayal and that these wounds still linger.
118-cyclops.name: Cyclops

properties.shortdesc: Cyclopeans are tragic figurs, once the master smiths of giant kind, using their...

119-sand_elemental.description: The four major elemental planes share hidden borders, where their essences intermingle. As looming Magma Elementals populate the vast volcanic trenches below the endless oceans of the aquatic plane, the relentless rasp-winds of the aerial plane instill the terran plane's sand with life, causing Sand Elementals to rise from the arid dunes, finding their way through weak points of the planar veil into the profane world.
119-sand_elemental.name: Sand Elemental

properties.shortdesc: The four major elemental planes share hidden borders, where their essences intermingle.

120-vampire_dreg.description: Dregs are found at the bottom of the vampiric hierarchy, unloved offspring marked and transformed by the bestial nature of their sanguine legacy. They are driven by maddening hunger and the aching need to receive any semblance of acknowledgment from their creator. Once their hunger is satiated, they become even more dangerous, as the starved beast turns into a cunning predator, now pursuing its prey not out of desperation, but for its own debased amusement.
120-vampire_dreg.name: Vampire Dreg

properties.shortdesc: Dregs are found at the bottom of the vampiric hierarchy, unloved offspring marked and...

121-sporeshambler.description: Sporeshamblers are humanoid husks overtaken by a fungal infestation. These hosts become questing tendrils of the mycotic collective, connected to the greater network in sporular communion. The collective is in a state of continuous adaptation, dissecting every impression felt and every experience gathered by the shambling extensions of its will. Should resistance arise, waves of Sporeshamblers surge against it until the collective has gathered enough information to grow hunter organisms perfectly attuned to the weaknesses of their dedicated prey.
121-sporeshambler.name: Sporeshambler

properties.shortdesc: Sporeshamblers are humanoid husks overtaken by a fungal infestation.

122-gutterfist.description: Gutterfists are hard-boiled brawlers, back alley thugs, prizefighters, or gentlemen pugilists. They hold their ground against better-armored foes with nothing but rock-hard abs, moxie, and their bare hands. Eventually, even veteran warriors might find themselves outmaneuvered and pinned to the ground as a hail of fists dents their priceless armor, all while the Gutterfist spouts filthy limericks concerning the promiscuous nature of their opponents' mothers.
122-gutterfist.name: Gutterfist

properties.shortdesc: Gutterfists are hard-boiled brawlers, back alley thugs, prizefighters, or gentlemen...

123-blackfeather_huntress.description: After the Black Rose Abbey was plundered and put to the torch by a band of roving robber-knights, the Abbess and her sworn sisters turned it into a briar-wreathed bastion and founded the clandestine order of Blackfeather Huntresses, an all female institution of knight-hunters sworn to neither king nor realm. Everyone can petition the Abbey to seek vengeance for unjust transgressions, abuse of power or breaking of chivalrous oaths. If the petition is granted, the Blackfeather Hunt is called and a pair of Huntressess seeks out their knightly prey.
123-blackfeather_huntress.name: Blackfeather Huntress

properties.shortdesc: After the Black Rose Abbey was plundered and put to the torch by a band of roving...

124-ogre_maneater.description: Ogres are gluttonous and vile in nature, wild ogres even more so than their more civilized kin who hire themselves out as extra muscle for legally questionable endeavors. Some Ogres, however, gradually become more debased in their insatiable search for more and more food, eventually becoming dangerous, blood-drunk brutes hellbent on driving their carious tusks into everything they encounter, even taking their attention of ongoing fights to gorge themselves on the fallen combatants - much to the horror of eventual onlookers.
124-ogre_maneater.name: Ogre Maneater

properties.shortdesc: Raving cannibals always on the verge of a feeding frenzy.

125-satyr.description: Satyrs are minor fey who dedicate their lives to the pursuit of pleasure and excess. Due to their natural curiosity, they often find their way into the mundane world through rifts and gaps between planes, where they eagerly interact with its inhabitants. The danger posed by Satyrs is not immediately apparent - their inherent fey magic can plunge mortals into a state of intoxication that leads them to dissolve into a state of hedonistic ecstasy, losing their awareness of place and time before collapsing from exhaustion. Additionally, the satyric temperament can become increasingly unpredictable as the festivities approach their climax, and not infrequently, under the influence of intoxicating substances, the otherwise amicable and sociable creatures reveal their unpredictable and alien fey nature.
125-satyr.name: Satyr

properties.shortdesc: Satyrs are minor fey who dedicate their lives to the pursuit of pleasure and excess.

126-opulence_devil.description: Opulence Devils revel in subverting mortal structures and corrupting them from within, perhaps even more so than their infernal brethren. Concealed beneath the guise of opulent dignitaries, statesmen or merchant-princes bedecked in jewels, their ostentatious presence screams of extravagance and excess. They entice with promises and bargains, especially those who have little and crave much. Even in combat, these devils seek to tempt their foes, ultimately goading them into their own damnation.
126-opulence_devil.name: Opulence Devil

properties.shortdesc: Opulence Devils revel in subverting mortal structures and corrupting them from within...

127-constrictor_drake.description: It doesn't take much imagination to understand why Constrictor Drakes bear their name, as they are the most serpentine of the lesser Wyverns, from their hunting methods to their puff adder-like jaws and tooth shape. They combine the worst qualities of snake and wyverns, resulting in a venomous, choke-happy, flying serpent the size of a horse. The Constrictor Drake's vivid warning colors only heighten one's unease because one can only imagine the kind of predator they are trying to deter.
127-constrictor_drake.name: Constrictor Drake

properties.shortdesc: Wyvern with snake-like attributes.

128-voidmare_wailer.description: Voidmare Wailers hail from the eponymous Voidmare, a nightmarish prison dimension steeped in cosmic darkness. Beings banished into the black cells of the Voidmare lose themselves in isolation and void-chill, eventually pupating and morphing into weeping and wailing monstrosities infused with the dimension's tortuous, hungering for the dreams and memories of living beings, their own lost forever.
128-voidmare_wailer.name: Voidmare Wailer

properties.shortdesc: Voidmare Wailers hail from the eponymous Voidmare, a nightmarish prison dimension...

129-undead_archer.description: The legendary Undead Archers of the Burial Host serve as tireless artillery units, inexorable in their mission to provide cover for the marching troops. The Host's shambling hordes advance through a torrent of Rothail arrows. Even though their deteriorated musculature only allows the use of shortbows, they can be deployed further forward than regular archers, as an undead archer felled by return fire may rise again to continue their ceaseless barrage. Even when outmaneuvered and locked in Melee combat, the Host's archers refuse to yield, continuing their unrelenting volleys until physically incapable of doing so.
129-undead_archer.name: Undead Archer

properties.shortdesc: The legendary Undead Archers of the Burial Host serve as tireless artillery units...

130-automaton_enforcer.description: Automaton Enforcers represent the culmination of generations of arcane artistry and inventive genius. Hulking avatars of steam and steel, these constructs house arcane reactors capable of producing electrical discharges and executing protocols that mimic cognitive thought. While their utility is hampered by a lack of autonomy and the demands of intricate maintenance, they occasionally find purpose as coveted prestige items among esteemed guild artisans or as experimental support units within forward-thinking security forces.
130-automaton_enforcer.name: Automaton Enforcer

properties.shortdesc: Automaton Enforcers represent the culmination of generations of arcane artistry and...

131-graftsman.description: Graftsmen occupy the lowest caste among the fleshcrafters of the Burial Host. As journeymen that have not yet passed their master's examination, they don't have access to the most choice resources from the Host's Limbchambers, Fleshpits and charnel houses. Instead, they have to scavenge battlefields or undertake personal raids in search of suitable parts for their projects. However, this makes them flexible and pragmatic improvisers who don't shy away from using less subtle and monstrous grafts, a practice frowned upon in the upper castes. Eager to practice advanced techniques on themselves, they are easily recognizable by their mismatched limbs, hulking statue and gruff demeanor.
131-graftsman.name: Graftsman

properties.shortdesc: Graftsmen occupy the lowest caste among the fleshcrafters of the Burial Host.

132-animated_blade.description: Animated Blades are swords imbued with arcane essence, a semblance of life breathing through them. This phenomenon can occur through enchantment magic, ancient rituals, or more rarely, the awakening of the blade itself. Driven by a deep-seated thirst for combat or an unquenchable desire for revenge, these blades act on their own, no longer requiring a wielder to carry out their intended purpose. Some of these blades are tasked with guarding treasure chambers or wizards' studies, while others tirelessly roam the the tombs and castles of their long-forgotten masters.
132-animated_blade.name: Animated Blade

properties.shortdesc: Animated Blades are swords imbued with arcane essence, a semblance of life breathing...

133-ratfolk_gutterskulk.description: Wherever damp tunnel networks extend beneath sprawling cities, one can find those who have chosen the Undercity as their domain. Shunned by even the less human-like races due to their unsettling appearance and unsavory reputation, the parallel worlds beneath the great cities are often a realm of matted fur, gnashing teeth, and crooked blades. And if one takes a wrong turn in the tunnels, it's possible to find themselves confronted by a dozen pairs of yellow-gleaming eyes in the darkness.
133-ratfolk_gutterskulk.name: Ratfolk Gutterskulk

properties.shortdesc: Wherever damp tunnel networks extend beneath sprawling cities, one can find those who...

134-rock_golem.description: Hewn from solid rock, these lumbering behemoths lack the sophisticated intricacies of their more contemporary stone or metal counterparts. Instead, they embody the raw essence of ritualistic craftsmanship, of a time when the creation of golems was steeped in mystic rites rather than the precise incantations of modern magical science. The Rock Golem still harbors traces of elemental powers long lost to its more polished successors, echoing the ancient secrets of a lost era.
134-rock_golem.name: Rock Golem

properties.shortdesc: Hewn from solid rock, these lumbering behemoths lack the sophisticated intricacies of...

135-skeletal_swashbuckler.description: Life at sea is perilous and offers myriad ways to meet an untimely demise be it disease, violence, or the raw brutality of the elements. Yet, amidst this danger, sailors have discovered diverse means to transcend mortality, seldom by choice. Ancient curses, bonds to captain, crew, and vessel transcending death, or the mystical sway of natural forces all ensure a sailor's journey sometimes doesn't conclude with death. The Skeletal Swashbucklers are undead mariners who defy decay, their bleached bones pulsating with a lingering thrill for adventure and peril, refusing to succumb to mere oblivion.
135-skeletal_swashbuckler.name: Skeletal Swashbuckler

properties.shortdesc: Life at sea is perilous and offers myriad ways to meet an untimely demise be it...

136-tyrannosaurus_rex.description: Amidst the dense, primeval jungles of the Archipelago, lurks a creature whose presence alone invokes visions of primal power,the Tyrannosaurus Rex. Known as the Jungle Monarch in the indigenous xotl language, this colossal predator embodies an ancient and fearsome majesty that evolution wasn't able to improve upon. Its thunderous footfalls reverberate through the foliage, conjuring images of bygone eras of lost worlds and untamed wilderness. Its towering form and menacing maw evoke the very essence of raw, untamed nature, a prehistoric force that roams the land, instilling a sense of ancient danger and primal instincts in all who dare to wander these unforgiving territories.
136-tyrannosaurus_rex.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex

212-ratfolk_sewersniper.description: A skittering sharpshooter firing infectious munition; not above playing dead to escape.

properties.shortdesc: A skittering sharpshooter firing infectious munition; not above playing dead to escape.

212-uvargandr.description: The name Uvargandr made its way from the tongue of the giants into the Common Speech and means something like storm-monstrosity. Uvargandr belong to the lesser dragons, much closer to wyrms than to the winged representatives of their kind. They compensate for this lack of grace and elegance with extreme ferocity. An aggressive Uvargandr never stays still; it is in constant motion with the explosive dynamism of a lunging crocodile, and every charge, leap, and movement is accompanied by flash explosions. The Uvargandrs scaled hide is known to flake off or be shed by the creature itself, these Storm Scale Chunks discharging in further explosions as it goes, making combat against this violent beast even more disorienting and chaotic.
212-uvargandr.name: Uvargandr

properties.shortdesc: A flightless dragon with massive jaws, lightning attacks and a temper.

213-hellracer_boarding_imp.description: Boarding Imps gather into chaotic crews, each bitterly hostile to the others, bound by both a feud system so convoluted that no outsider could ever hope to unravel it, as well as a collective addiction to the exhausts produced by pouring demonic ichor directly into the billowing furnace of infernal war machines. They specialize in high-speed boarding maneuvers, uncaring of the very likely possibility of grievous bodily harm, set about hurling the crew overboard or committing unspeakable acts upon the vehicles inner machinery. More often than not, such assaults end in catastrophic pileups, leaving behind nothing but smoking wrecks, charred husks, and sticky trails smeared across the road.
213-hellracer_boarding_imp.name: Hellracer Boarding Imp

properties.shortdesc: Specialize in high-speed boarding maneuvers, accepting death in the process.

214-draconic_devotee.description: Fanatical cultists able defy death and empower their patron through acts of faith.
214-draconic_devotee.name: Draconic Devotee

properties.shortdesc: Fanatical cultists able defy death and empower their patron through acts of faith.

215-beast_of_soot_and_sulphur.description: Also known as black chimeras, beasts of soot and sulphur inhabit regions characterized by fire-scoured desolatiob: Areas ravaged by volcanic activity, territories under a fire dragon's rule, or sites of planar activity. When unobserved, they drift as ghostly shades, formless swathes of ash and embers that, without warning, coalesce into a ravening beast.
215-beast_of_soot_and_sulphur.name: Beast Of Soot And Sulphur

properties.shortdesc: Highly mobile, a violent beast with a vast and volatile arsenal.

216-hellracer_hellwright.description: Hellwrights have devoted themselves to the soul-devouring furnace-engines of the infernal vehicle pool. over centuries of use, many of these machines begin to develop personalities of their own, and hellwrights are able to get the most out of them through a deliberate mix of carrot and stick, that is sacrifices and machine curses. hellwrights with similar interests or design philosophies often gather into cult-like conclaves, marked by a suprising amount of jovial cooperation and a subordination of personal quarrels in pursuit of increasingly obscene technological perversions. their loyalty typically lies first with their machines, second with their conclave, and only third with their respective lords or patrons. but due to their vast knowledge and indispensable connections, they are usually granted a fair amount of leeway and autonomy. a fact that hellwrights have learned to exploit with great skill and delight.
216-hellracer_hellwright.name: Hellracer Hellwright

properties.shortdesc: Boosts friendly Infernal War Machines, while cursing hostile ones.

217-ghoul_monarch.description: Draped in tattered regalia and clinging to a memory of nobility, this towering undead presides over a decaying court of delusion. it is caught in reenactments of tragic pageantry, assigning roles to its ghoulish courtiers in a theatre of obedience, grotesquely mirroring the courtial ceremonies. once, perhaps, it was a noble soul, now it is a broken vessel barely containing starved frenzy. its mind frays at the edges, torn between moments of feral hunger and memories of royal grandeur, collapsing into shame when lucidity returns.
217-ghoul_monarch.name: Ghoul Monarch

properties.shortdesc: A tragic fallen king teetering at the brink of delusion and madness.

218-giant_mantis_bride.description: There are various factors that can cause ordinary creatures and critters to grow to monstrous size. their true danger often stems from the fact that not only are their physical attributes  massively magnified, which especially for insects more often than not is nightmarish in its own right, but also behavioral traits are manifested in extreme ways. in the case of the giant mantis, the mating rituals of female and male representatives can spiral into catastrophic proportions. swarms of frenzied male consorts attempt to prove their worth as hunters and defenders to a towering bride, resulting in dramatic declines in local populations. the mantis bride stands at the heart of the frenzyvastly larger than the males and immeasurably more dangerous. she rules over her hopelessly enamored consorts with an iron claw, demanding a constant offering of worthy prey. she does not hesitate for a moment to punish an unworthy gift by devouring the hopeful suitor on the spot.
218-giant_mantis_bride.name: Giant Mantis Bride

properties.shortdesc: Leads a swarm of desperate Consorts into battle.

219-giant_mantis_consort.description: there are various factors that can cause ordinary creatures and critters to grow to monstrous size. their true danger often stems from the fact that not only are their physical attributes  massively magnified, which especially for insects more often than not is nightmarish in its own right, but also behavioral traits are manifested in extreme ways. in the case of the giant mantis, the mating rituals of female and male representatives can spiral into catastrophic proportions. swarms of frenzied male consorts attempt to prove their worth as hunters and defenders to a towering bride, resulting in dramatic declines in local populations. the consorts are locked in a destructive competition for the favor of the bride. driven by the presence of their coveted queen and surrounded by countless rivals, they hurl themselves into the fray with little regard for their own safety. each selects what they deem to be a worthy offering and attempts to present it to their capricious bride-to-be, often only to be consumed by her on the spot. should a consort be fortunate enough to win her favor, he remains by her side to defend her, hoping thatonce the dust has settledhe may finally mate with her. but even this act is rarely without fatal consequences.
219-giant_mantis_consort.name: Giant Mantis Consort

properties.shortdesc: Captures prey and presents it to his bride with middling success.

220-corrupted_champion.description: Corruption and taint can take many forms, especially when countless entities across the planes eagerly wait to bestow their dubious gifts. whether through willing acceptance or infection, corruption can find a foothold in the souls or bodies of creatures and begin to bloom. it promises boundless strength and power, but ultimately always at the cost of one's own self.
220-corrupted_champion.name: Corrupted Champion

properties.shortdesc: Adapts and regenerates, causes festering wounds.

221-hellracer_roadrager.description: these devils are cursed with roadrage, a mysterious compulsion afflicting those who spend too much time near the soul-fueled war machines of the infernal planes. once they take the helm of a vehicle, their aggression spikes, escalating with every passing moment until it erupts into mindless, self-destructive fury. though they should be solitary creatures, some unknown compulsion drives them to tolerate each other just long enough to form volatile packs. when loosed upon the infernal wastelands, these collectives become one more looming danger, packs of frenzied fiends venting their rage on anything that crosses their path, be it locals, travelers, or a rival gang.
221-hellracer_roadrager.name: Hellracer Roadrager

properties.shortdesc: Powerful melee bully suffering from infectious roadrage.

222-vampire_roadstalker.description: Just as roads serve as  vital arteries of any land,it should come as no surprise that they draw the attention of vampires. and although it is fundamentally a mistake to assume any kind of nobility in the vampiric condition, certain individuals cannot be denied a faint, aristocratic charm. even those vampires who, through various circumstances, exist on the fringe of society and must stoop to the level of common highwaymen and brigands to sate their thirst, or who prefer this down-to-earth style of hunting for personal reasons, possess a kind of rugged charisma. they use it to draw travelers under their spell and lure them out of the safety of the light, indulging in their atavistic nature in more sense than one.
222-vampire_roadstalker.name: Vampire Roadstalker

properties.shortdesc: Lures prey into ambushes.

223-ratfolk_swarm_squeaker.description: Wherever damp tunnel networks extend beneath sprawling cities, one can find those who have chosen the undercity as their domain. shunned by even the less human-like races due to their unsettling appearance and unsavory reputation, the parallel worlds beneath the great cities are often a realm of matted fur, gnashing teeth, and crooked blades. and if one takes a wrong turn in the tunnels, its possible to find themselves confronted by a dozen pairs of yellow-gleaming eyes in the darkness.
223-ratfolk_swarm_squeaker.name: Ratfolk Swarm Squeaker

properties.shortdesc: Utilizes swarms of vermin to buff, debuff and displace.

224-krampus.description: Krampus was once a man who committed terrible deeds. as punishment, he was cursed to roam the lands, given the chance to present his soul for reevaluation at the end of each year - if it is free from guilt, the curse will be lifted. instead of putting in the work, krampus abducts children in the twisted attempt to pass their innocent souls off as his own and break the curse. he hasnt been successful, but not for the lack of trying. he is accompanied by sacklings, ramshackle constructs inhabited by stolen child souls, because naturally it is their fault that his curse is not lifted.
224-krampus.name: Krampus

properties.shortdesc: Turns opponents into children to steal their souls.
properties.hidden_tags: christmas, oneshot, boss, event, creepy, narrative, athmosphere

225-sackling_swarmer.description: Sacklings are simple constructs with a dark history. they were used to be created by binding a child's soul into a small, ragged body made from hemp, wool, straw, and any sharp materials that could be worked into it to make it functional in combat. in the present day, only the cruelest and most unhinged still make use of childrens souls in this way, as there are far more practical methods to exploit such a valuable prize. over time, different variants of sacklings have evolved to serve different purposes, but the simple swarmer remains a classic, used to overwhelm a creature, drag it to the floor, and inflict death by a thousand cuts.
225-sackling_swarmer.name: Sackling Swarmer

properties.shortdesc: Surge toward victims to drag them down and stab relentlessly.

226-stirge.description: Attacks in swarms to drain blood, carrier of disease.
226-stirge.name: Stirge

properties.shortdesc: Attacks in swarms to drain blood, carrier of disease.

226-swarm_of_stirges.description: attacks in swarms to drain blood, carrier of disease.
226-swarm_of_stirges.name: Swarm Of Stirges

properties.shortdesc: Attacks in swarms to drain blood, carrier of disease.

227-awakened_iron_maiden.description: An iron maiden's purpose is twofold: to inflict death and pain, but also to serve, through its mere presence, as a grim reminder of the many ways it can be used. it is a symbol of oppression and torture, and it is no surprise that some of them awaken, either as a result of the atrocities committed within them or deliberately, to get even more out of it.
227-awakened_iron_maiden.name: Awakened Iron Maiden

properties.shortdesc: Imprisons and impales.

228-greater_earth_elemental.description: elementals are splinters of those immense manifestations of primordial power whose mere existence tore open the veil between planes and claimed a domain of their own, so that the young world could breathe at all. from these primal forces, elemental manifestations are born, and so are earth elementals. the categories between lesser and greater elementals are distinctions that are often hardly possible to draw in any truly reliable way, due to the underlying alienness of their nature. still, one can say that greater elementals show a closer, purer connection to their primordial source matter, command more powerful abilities, and pose a greater danger to those who find themselves confronted by them.
228-greater_earth_elemental.name: Greater Earth Elemental

properties.shortdesc: Withstands but the most devastating attacks and responds in kind.
